All Reviews

  1. This would be a great product if they take the mini saws off the edges. Those things slice through tender skin like it is butter. The shaver part works great but is almost impossible to use because of the saws on both sides. I guess they thought this is a hedge trimmer.
  2. The battery quickly degraded after a few months and the head broke, so the cutter wouldn't stay attached the warranty process wasn't worth it.
  3. This groomer is not recommended. It does well on arms, chest, legs. It will however, pull and cut your private area. Once again - move on, this is not the one for you. UPDATE: I needed a new blade attachement. Threw this one away and bought a BG2028. The newer model and blade work fantastic. No cuts or scary groin bleeding yet :)
  4. I purchased one of these in 2011. My observations are that the clipper extensions were extraordinarily difficult to put on and off -- and I was alway afraid of breaking them because they were plastic.<br /><br />After 25 or so uses over 2 and a half years the on/off button wore out.<br /><br />I did not think it was particularly well built and I am going to try a different brand now.
  5. The performance of this device is as in other reviews: it works quite well.<br /><br />However, this model is notorious for a design flaw where the plastic head that holds the foil (aka the blade assembly) can become loose and unable to hold the foil in place. Some people never have this problem, but I was one of the unlucky ones -after about a year (~10 uses), the plastic head was no longer able to hold the foil in place, rendering the device unusable.<br /><br />Well, the other day I finally got around to digging up the warranty/instruction booklet, and the device is under a two-year warranty. I called Phillips' warranty center and they were able to identify my unit /w just the information on the device itself (didn't need my receipt or the UPC code I had cut out & saved). I got a representative quickly on the line, and she arranged for a replacement plastic head to be sent.<br /><br />I got the package about a week and a half later, and it was the wrong part -they sent me a replacement foil. So I call in again (this time they only needed my phone #) and explain the issue. The representative was very apologetic, and looked into the issue further. Turns out, they no longer are able to supply the plastic head component of the device, so they went ahead and arranged for a new unit (/w a tag in it to return the old defective one to them) to be sent to me.<br /><br />Although the mistake was kind of annoying, I did get a free foil out of it, and am getting a new unit in the end, so I'm pretty happy. As long as you're covered by warranty (and don't destroy the device yourself), it seems they're a decent company who will take care of their customers, at least for these types of lifestyle products.
  6. Would recommend for any guys wanting to trim down for a neater appearance. I had 60 years of growth that now looks trimmed and neat. Just like getting a haircut. My wife likes the new look. Used the number one attachment for most of my body and no attachment for under arms and intimates.
  7. I agree with most posts on here, the attachments are hard to use, but it does do the job. One thing to point out is mine stopped working with only about 2 uses per month after about 18 months. I have \\"refreshed\\" the batteries 3 times now (fully drain, recharge, fully drain) and I still only get a few minutes of \\"full power\\" before it goes about 1/2 speed for the rest of the charge. I'm going to try one more unit, but I'm getting a SquareTrade Warranty this time in case it has the same battery trouble.
  8. Works very well. I did not get one nick or cut when shaving those sensitive areas. The only downside I found is that the detachable combs are a little tricky to get on and off.
  9. It is very rare I find a product that I so strongly dislike and well this is it. I purchased this product a few years back and found that although it was crafted cleverly to appeal on the eye and look good it was far from that. I found that simply cutting long body hairs in simple places became a choir for this groomer or it just painfully pulled hair right out. This often caused the head of the trimmer to fill up or even pop off. Regardless, I purchased this product to remove hair from the back and neck and well after about 6 uses too many this product became a resident of my garbage can. If you have thick hair or pain sensories in your skin...avoid using this product and pick up a Remington or a regular Conair hair trimmer to get the job done.
  10. This thing works better that I had hoped especially in the very sensitive male areas and underarms. It worked flawlessly! I was so impressed I got brave and trimmed my long chest & stomach hair using the length control attachments. Again the results were excellent. I got braver still and did my arms and legs experimenting with the different lengths. When I was done with that, I got the bravest yet and did my eyebrows and it worked great. I'm thrilled I bought this. Luckily it came up on my Amazon recommendations and I bought it because I was sick of poor results and cuts from a cordless Subeam clipper I was using.
  11. i am a woman, and i bought this men's electric shaver to use on my legs, underarms, and bikini area. the main reason why i bought it was because i have a mangled leg from an accident, and i found it hard to shave around all the bumps, ridges and scars with a disposable. it works fine, but not as smooth as a cheap disposable razor. you can actually feel it pulling the hairs...not terribly painful, but i can feel it. it has not cut me once since ive been using it, for about a month now. i am happy with it.
  12. This is a great shaver. I've used it so far on my chest, back, and underarms and it has done a wonderful job. I bought it from amazon for $30. Definitely worth the price!
  13. I know the title can be a little confusing so let me explain. The motor on the razor is really good and the razor itself is very ergonomical. And its great that its waterproof. Now the bad. The replaceable razor foils are cheap and very poorly engineered. I have had several break on me and actually scratch my skin. The foils will sometimes push down inside the little plastic piece that holds them together. Once they ever bend a little like that they are useless. I have actually messed up a foil taking off the guard before...ugh! They arent cheap either, about $10 a piece. If they made some better foils this would be great but the foils just ruin it for me.

Let's see if the warranty is any good now... The upside on this product... I like the fact that it is cordless.

  25. There are already nearly 800 reviews of this product so it is highly unlikely that I can substantively offer much to the discussion which has already been had, but, I'll put in my two-cents nonetheless. As a bodybuilder, I like to keep a \\"clean\\" look. I picked this shaver up from Target for about $10 more than it is listed here (at the time of this review), mostly because I wanted to (finally) try it out and thought it might serve as an alternative to waxing. First - no, it's not an alternative to waxing. It does leave stubble. Second - there is no way I would (a) take this anywhere above the neckline and, more importantly, (b) take this thing anywhere below the belt-line. The product manual indicates that you should not use it above the neck, but I mention it because others seemingly have used it on their face/head. Again, whether the manual said anything about it or not, I still would never do it. While I suffered no cuts or gashes (as others seemingly have), it did \\"pull\\" and \\"tug\\" a bit while doing my chest, back, underarms, etc. It was not painful per se, but it was definitely momentarily uncomfortable and raised serious doubts about venturing further south. Nay, for points south, I will stick to using [[ASIN:B001G7PTVQ Gillette Mach3 Disposable, Sensitive, 3-Count (Pack of 2)]] or [[ASIN:B003U4CJT8 Bic Flex 4 - 1 Pack]] with some [[ASIN:B003I87A2M Gillette Comfort Advantage Shave Gel (4 pack)]]. Third - I tried this both dry and wet. While it is a somewhat nice idea that this can be taken in the shower, it is not altogether practical. Hairs have a tendency to stick to the body when wet and, unless you use some manner of light soap/shave cream/shave gel, sliding this thing across a wet body is not as easy as it is while dry. Using this dry is definitely a better alternative. I also found the attachments to be pretty much useless. In addition, note that due to the short handle of this product, completely doing one's back is a two-person job. This is especially true for us bodybuilders; my arms are large and reaching around to the middle of my back is no easy task...if not impossible. Fourth - in fairness, for the most part, it does what it says it will do, but I can't help but feel there are better options out there. This will be going back. All in all, Not recommended.
  26. You get what you pay for with this thing. Eventually after some use, the blades can grab your hair and the whole blade falls off (in my case in the toilet which I had to dig out on multiple occasions). I was able to bend the plastic catch out a little bit and it doesn't do it anymore. Also, cut very slowly. This thing will work fine if you go slow. The double-sided clipper comes in very handy getting in the nooks and crannies. Holds a charge for a good amount of time, too!
  27. I bought this body shaver about 5 years ago and yes, it's still working after enduring 5 years of once-every-fortnight usage. On that account, it's a plus. It also works as advertised, trimming hairs below the neck pretty neatly. But, I've also had 3 or 4 instances when I suffered minor cuts from using this shaver. Nevertheless, it's still not too bad for 5 years of consistent use. The spare [[ASIN:B000MN63CO Philips Norelco Bodygroom Replacement Trimmer/Shaver Foil]] that I've bought together with the shaver is still unopened. On hindsight, maybe I should have used it. However, like other users, I've also encountered one serious design/manufacturing flaw with this product. Due to the way the on/off toggle switch is constructed and probably also the material the button is made of, I've had a few times when the switch just got stuck after the shaver was turned on. So you can imagine the panic when you try to turn the shaver off in the bathroom and it just refuses to. The first time it happened, no matter how many times I've tried, it just wouldn't turn off. I had to leave it running to exhaust its own battery power. Not a pretty nor quiet sight. This gadget is very loud when it's running. There was another time when I left it in the stand and it just decided to turn on by itself. Again, it stopped after exhausting itself. Thankfully, it happens less now for reasons I cannot explain. Sometimes, I just had to press a few more times to unstuck the off button. But, these weird incidents just knock a few notches off the overall experience.
  28. Great product at a decent price. The product works well. I recommend it. Philips Norelco makes good shaving products: this one is no exception.
  29. I've used other body groomers and I'm always bracing myself for the inevitable nick and cut, but I have yet to receive on with this one. Without the attachments it works better than I ever expected, its close, smooth and very effective whether its in or out of the shower. However I have had problems using the attachments, they seem to clog up quickly and don't really work that well. I haven't had it long but it was quickly apparent that this was money well spent.

  31. I love this shaver! I've used it for years on my bikini zone and never cut myself once. It's so much faster and safer than a razor blade and gives me a closer shave, as I can go against the grain without fear. I've tried women's shavers but they never seem to DO anything. (I'll run them over the hair a dozen times and still have stubble) This shaver, however, gets me completely smooth in no time. I only have two little problems with it: 1, it has a hard time cutting the thinner, finer hairs on the edge of my pubes, but those are easy to get with a razor. and 2, the smooth, contoured shape of the handle is hard to hold onto when your hand is slippery with soap or shaving cream. I usually have to hold it around the neck. Other than that, no complaints.<br /><br />I've seen a lot of guys complaining of irritation so here are a few tips for shaving your naughty-bits:<br />1. Regardless of how or what you remove the hair with, it's going to be itchy red hell for at least a week, sometimes as much as a few months. The only way to get past it is to keep shaving regularly until your body gets used to it. Once you've gown accustomed to it you have to keep it up, if you let it go for a few months and then shave again, the itchy red hell will start all over.<br />2. DON'T SCRATCH! AT ALL! EVER! A lot of guys scratch themselves without even realizing it, STOP!<br />3. Shave in the shower so you can use soap or shaving cream, which means less irritation. If you have a hard time seeing what you're doing, use your hand to feel for stubble.<br />4. Splash cold water on your bits after shaving. It's uncomfortable, but will really cut down on the itchiness.<br />5. Pat baby powder on after you shave to avoid itching caused by sweating. If you anticipate some \\"fun\\" later on use this instead [[ASIN:B0012ZNSWE Monistat Soothing Care Chafing Relief Powder-Gel]] . Unlike baby powder, it leaves behind no odor or flavor, but doesn't work quite as well.<br />6. Tight fitting pants and undiescan make irritation worse and cause ingrown hairs, keep things loose and soft.
  32. First off, let me say that I hate body hair and yet somehow was born with the genes of Chewbacca. I shave a lot. In the past, I have been using Gillette razors. But it was getting expensive to constantly buy replacement heads. So I was excited to try an electric replacement, especially with so many good reviews. Well, I have to say that I'm pretty disappointed. Believe me, I really tried to give this thing a chance. But its just not doing the job. For one, its slow. I have to run over the same spot several times for it to cut all the hair, when a razor can usually get it all in one zip. So it takes me probably more than twice the amount of time for my normal routine. (I shave in the shower. So by then, I'm out of hot water - no fun). The other problem is that the end result is NOT smooth at all. I don't mind a little stubble on my face. But not on my chest. I feel like after I'm done I have to go back over it with my razor. I just don't get it. How is this product getting so many good reviews? I count on these to make good purchases.<br />I normally wouldn't give just a 1 star rating. But I feel I need to to offset so many 4s and 5s. Even for the decent price, its still not worth it.

  34. I have owned the Philips Norelco Bodygroom Shaver for approximately six years. I use it as an adjunct to a regular hair trimmer to provide a closer cut. Certainly the motor is not as strong as a regular hair trimmer. However, the advantages include a closer cut and less potential for damage in those \\"tender\\" areas. With a non-replaceable battery, I guess it's also a positive that it still takes a charge after six years.<br /><br />So, what's the problem? The method of attaching the foil head to the groomer, does not work long term. After a few dozen uses it began falling out occasionally. Subsequently, it began falling out several times with each use. When it almost never stayed in I replaced the foil. Unfortunately, that did zero to resolve the problem. It still works, but it is frustrating to use and I would not purchase another unless this problem is rectified by the manufacturer. It seems clear to me that the large number of four and five star reviews are by people who have only used the Bodygroom Shaver a few times, before this problem becomes apparent.
  35. In general, I like the product and it does a good job. I've owned it for a couple years now.<br /><br />I'm a little wary of it though. It's not as \\"foolproof safe\\" as people would suggest. One day I was trimming the hedges and hit a raised mole. It made a bit of a \\"THWACK\\" sound I was in some sudden pain with a little bit of bleeding. It took the mole halfway off. Since that day I've been wary of this thing around \\"bumps on the surface\\". I still think it's better for its purpose than standard electric razors... but I'm still careful with it because I have to be.
  36. I can't say much that hasn't already been said about this product. I decided to go with this model and not the newer, pricier one because I'm not a really hairy guy (I can't grow a full beard, no chest, back, or torso hair, only armpits and private parts) Like the famous review says, this product is shaft, sack, and starfish safe; I'd like to add to that armpit and nipple safe as well. I have had it for about a month now and have not had any nicks, cuts, or pinches. Sometimes I'm not even that careful and this shaver will simply not harm my body in any way. I absolutely LOVE that I can use this product in the shower, I love shaving under running water, something I haven't been able to do with any other shaver for fear of shock or ruining it. It also makes it a breeze to clean! I only take it out of the shower to charge, usually let it dry for a day just in case. Before I had this shaver I was never able to shave/trim my body hair down to zero for fear of cuts (I got many), so it was a new and cool experience to be almost completely hairless the first time I used it. It's so safe you can shave with confidence, needless to say the girlfriend noticed right away and loves the new look. If you don't want to go down to no hair the three attachments give you three good levels of grooming. I use a No. 2 for certain areas and I'm more than happy with the length. I can't recommend this product enough, skip the more expensive one and go for this model, unless you are at a Robin Williams level.

No bumps, very smooth shave front and back side. I do not use the Norelco on the Kiwi's, I use the Gillette Fusion, the Norelco will nick the Kiwi fruit skin and that is not fun.   38. This shaver is amazing. I never thought an electric razor would work so well on the body. Seriously. I had previously used a disposible razor for body shaving. However.. the shave is not quite as close as an actual disposable razor got. There's still a little stubble on my chest and arm pits. But, it's acceptable. That's a good trade off for not having bumps or anything. My only other minor complaint is that the guard clips, like other reviews have said, are really hard to get off once you clip them on. This is a really minor problem because I only ever clip one of them on to trim up the one area every few weeks. Everything else I use the regular foil with out the guards, so it's really not a problem. And I'd rather it be too stuck on there then falling off. Overall.. I definitely recomend. I know there is a newer version out, but I love this one so I can't even recomend paying more for the other. If you shave or trim your body hair (which every man should), you should get this razor.

  44. This is a good product, but the cleaning instructions for it were inadequate for me. It stopped working after I did my legs and required cleaning. I opened the foil head into two parts and soaked both in Philips Norelco HQ200 Jet Clean Solution for awhile (maybe half an hour). Then I soaked them both in rubbing alcohol for about half an hour. After that, I let them dry, put them back together, and was able to shave again okay. I don't necessarily recommend my cleaning methods, but I'm just letting you know you may have to get mavericky with the cleaning.

A negative about using the groomer in water is that it sometimes becomes slippery (especially if you're using lather) and I've nearly dropped it a couple of times. I'm going to try wrapping the strap around my wrist for some extra security (althought that will also hamper maneuverability). <br /> <br />The only other negative I've found is that even at the shortest level the comb is too long for the close type of trimming I prefer - I don't like to shave all the way down to the skin (irritation) on my abs, and I can't quite get the trim short enough - or at least as short as I was able to with my regular trimmer. <br /> <br />Otherwise, I think it's a great product and am considering buying another just in case something goes wrong with this one. It's not the best trimmer in the world, but for the price it's surprisingly functional and I'm quite satisfied with it.

I prefer to use it in the shower since it's a wet/dry trimmer. One thing I would recommend is to purchase a lotion to put on after you shave. This trimmer will get a really smooth effect without the cuts but if your skin isn't use to it ya might get that painful rash for a few days. Buy in confidence..this trimmer works 100%
  64. yeah so i picked this up after dealing with a normal size cordless hair clipper - like the ones used in a barber shop. even though it might not match up in cutting power or speed, the bodygroom can definitely get into spaces and grooves the larger my older one cannot. take your time and you can too can look like a dude on the cover of GQ. in addition, i really like the fact that you can go without attachments and just use the foil. i was pretty afraid that i would cause some major bleeding but the actual trimming blades are well designed not to catch skin. aside from some VERY light nicking, i came out clean. well done norelco!
  65. Guys for real this thing ROCKS! I only recently got to use it and thorough away the old stuff! the family jewels are safer than ever with this trimmer! if your jungle man like Dane Cook once said, then this is the trimmer for u! The ladies will appreciate the usage on this i am telling u! they will appreciate it!!!
  66. Does a great job of removing hair of all kind. Runs much quieter than other groomers and is more effective.
  67. It works well for short, fine hair in just one sweep. It takes a little more effort for anything else. A small amount of hair clogs up the razor cutting edge pretty quickly, but it can be easily washed out with water. The overall benefit of this probably is that it does not cut off more than you want at any one sweep. The dual sided cutting head is a great advantage since it avoids a lot of contortion to get both sides of your body. It's a bit more expensive than other similar grooming razors.
  68. This takes forever to use. You need to go over a portion of your body many times to get all the hair. But for the price, it does the job.
  69. I picked this unit up so I can see how it shaves my boys. The trimming attachment heads are not very useful in my opinion. In fact, I would recommend trimming the hair down there to the shortest length possible first with a regular beard trimmer. Shaving your skin smooth on the testicles and shaft is a chore. It took way too many passes with this shaver to get the skin relatively smooth. I understand if one is looking for absolute smoothness, then a manual razor is the way to go. However, this products is touted as being ideal for shaving the groin area smooth, and in my opinion, this shaver does that job fairly. As I mentioned, be prepared to spend some time down there going over the same spot to get it smooth, plus, you have to VERY careful not to nick yourself with this thing. The trimmer things on each side of the unit can bite you if you are not careful enough to keep your skin taut while you go over an area. Obviously everyone has different hair lengths and thicknesses on their body. So even though I found this shaver to be simply adequate down below for me, it may work well or worse for others. I'd recommend giving it a try yourself. You don't have that much to lose because if you are unhappy with this unit, you can send it to Norelco within 60 days of purchase and they will refund your purchase price. I plan on trying the Remington BHT-2000 body shaver in the next month or two and will compare that unit against this one. ***UPDATE*** I recently purchased the Remington BHT-2000 body shaver and have reviewed it. Here's is an updated review comparing the Noreclo to the Remington: To begin, I find the Remington to be more solidly built than the Bodygroom. Plus, the Remington's smaller design makes it easier to maneuver around the groin area than the Bodygroom for trimming that area. Advantage: Remington. Secondly, I find the trimming capability of the Remington to be better than the Bodygroom. What I don't like about the Norelco is that is comes with flimsy detachable heads to use for trimming. I like how the Remington has a dial-type head (similar to what you see in most beard trimmers) in which you can choose from 5 setting for hair trimming. Advantage: Remington Thirdly, I found the shaving capability of the Remington to be quite poor compared to the Norelco. For either unit, it is recommended to trim the hair to the lowest setting before attempting to shave using the foil head. If you don't trim the hair first to as short as possible, the shaving head on each unit will not be able to shave the hair properly. Getting back to the review...the Remington dual head shaver attachment is unsatisfactory. It does not shave as close as the Norelco foil head, nor is it as irritation free as the Norelco foil head. I used the foil head on the Remington as gently as possible on both my testicles and part of the shaft, and I felt a stinging razor burn on two separate occasions. Eee-yowch. This did not happen with the Norelco Bodygroom. Advantage: Norelco. I would recommend that if you plan to simply trim your groin area, then your best bet is to go with the Remington as it is the better trimmer. If your desire is to shave your groin area as smooth as possible with an electric instrument, than your best bet is to go with the Norelco Bodygroom as it is the better shaver. Please understand, however, that even with the Norelco being used as a shaver, you will not experience a shave as close as you would by using a blade. Based on my experience, I find trimming the groin area to be the way to go instead of shaving the area. In order to keep the groin region hair free, you would have to shave that area every day. I find I can get by with trimming that area to a very short length once a week to keep it rather well maintained.
  70. no nicks. not as close as a blade, but so what--i am not a super model. i will trade a little less close for no cuts and quicker than regular shaving.

I recently bought a rechargeable battery for a Wahl trimmer for less than $10. I will look for another brand for a replacement, not another Bodygroom.

  79. Buyer be careful! This product does a great job when all the components stay together. Swipe it once (say, to remove water) and it falls apart easily . Getting a replacement for broken parts isn't easy. The combs really don't work, unless maybe you have really long hair a few cms long. Otherwise, you end up pressing really hard and still come away disappointed. Its either shave really clean (which it does well) or nothing - nothing in between. All said, if you're careful and know what you're doing, this one's pretty smooth at what it does and leaves the skin smooth.
  80. I am thrilled with the bodygrrom. I use extension 2 on the underarms, chest and stomach. The first time I used it, it did not do a great job on the underarms so I needed to use my other trimmer then use the body groomer. However now seems to work fine under my under arms. I also have an excellent trim on the chest and stomach. Now for the lower parts (groin area) I use extension 1 for everything, but for the \\"boys\\" use nothing. With previous trimmers I always used to get cut or nicked no matter how careful I was in this location. With the body groomer you still need to be careful, however I was taken aback with what a great job it did and without cuts or nicks. I have used it several times without incident. I always prefer to use dry never use wet so dont know how it works when wet. I would highly recommend.
  81. Here's the scoop, simply: it gets 5 stars because it does exactly what it's supposed to do, and it does it well. In ten minutes, I painlessly shaved hair from the parts of my body that I wanted to. No pinching, no rash, no blood, no problem. I didn't even bother with the extra accessories; I used it as is right out of the box. People often think that because extra stuff is included, it has to be used, but usually it's not needed. It's just for special cases, like apemen and werewolves, or maybe guys who for some reason like to make complex designs in their body hair. Hence, there's complaints about accessories falling off too easily or not coming off easily...but those 'problems' won't affect you at all if you're a fairly normal person who knows you don't always have to use every accessory included with an item. I left those cheap plastic blue things in the box and can't say that my life has been deprived in any way as a result. It's not gonna shave you anywhere near as close as a blade, but it's the best alternative, since you're not gonna be using a blade on sensitive areas. There's some lobotomy victims out there trying to use this thing on their face and complaining that it doesn't work well - just ignore their comments. If they can't even read the box, their opinions are of questionable merit. Bottom line is, how well this works for you depends on how thick your body hair is, what type of hair it is, and where you're shaving. I recommend it as the best product on the market for what it does - it's not a miracle product but it works just fine for me. Might be a different experience for you. Only one way to find out: try it yourself, and return it if you don't like it. That's what return policies are for. But just remember - DON'T use it on your face, or as a hammer, or as a q-tip, or as a remote control. It is for shaving your body hair. That's why it's called a body groomer. To be even more specific, it's primarily designed for painless trimming of your private areas. They just can't show a guy shaving his family jewels on the box, that's all.
  82. it works as expected. its really waterproof, which is a great feature. ive even been using shaving lotion with it which helps with the corseness of the hair removal. im thinking of starting to use the Philips Norelco® Electric Razor 1090 arcitec Rechargeable Cordless Tripleheader® to shave my face as well.

  84. Ok, I was a little skeptical when I ordered the Philips Bodygroom Shaver. I like to keep my body hair trimmed, and I've been using a regular hair clipper for awhile. I never use a razor because my skin is sensitive and I end up getting ingrown hairs. I was concerned that the Bodygroom Shaver would trim my hair too close, and that I would end up with ingrowns. However, I've been pleasantly surprised to find that it trims your hair really close-- but not so close that I end up with any ingrowns. I find that it's much easier to use that a regular hair clipper, and actually safer too. I used to nick myself with the clipper if I wasn't being careful. It's very powerful, and I like the fact that it's cordless and that the heads are replaceable. I think it's a great buy.

  88. This is a great personal groomer for the man who wants to make sure their parts below the neckline are trim and neat.<br /><br />The unit is rechargeable. A single charge will last a while.   90. This item is simple, inexpensive and easy to use. Have had no problems with it so far.
  91. A lot of people who complain about the Bodygroom talked about how it pulls hairs. Well I figured it was just because people hadn't pre-trimmed any longer hairs, but this is not always the case. Before purchasing the Bodygroom, I used to use scissors and/or a razor to take care of hair in various places, so my hair was already relatively short. The Bodygroom did a great, even job with most of it, but in some areas, especially where the hair is thicker (not specifically longer), there was still some pulling. After using it for a couple months, every once in a while I would still get a tug, but I think it is mainly because I wasn't using the shaver on a regular basis. This razor is extremely easy to operate, easy to clean (not easy to replace the blades if they get messed up, so be careful), and isn't awkward to hold or use. I think the problems that this shaver has would afflict any razor, so I can't fault it; I just wish these companies could come up with a system that didn't have pulling.

  102. I bought this expecting to use for shaving and trimming, because I didn't want to shave my whole body and look like a transformist. I have to disassemble the foil a few times during shaving because one side gets stuck to the bottom because I have to press it quite hard against the skin to make it work properly. If using it to shave, I would recommend to do it under the shower cause it makes it easier. Now, if it comes to trimming using the attachment combs, I can tell you it's a nightmare! The hair get stuck to the blades all the time and you must wipe it with the brush that comes with the package for every few seconds you trim or so... Even wiping it everytime it's very very hard to get a good result, specially for areas where the hair is very thick. I am pretty sure those blades are not sharp enough. Trimming without the attachment combs can be useful, specially under the shower because you can wash away the stuck hair all the time, but trimming like this nearly means shaving, and I would never do that on my legs for example! I got this product expecting a two-in-one thing, but definitely it is useless for trimming. Now I have to look for another one that suits my needs.
  103. Also, the blades scrape the skin, causing redness and irritation. This product pulls on your hair, with is painful.   127. I have tried all manor of hair removal in all manor of places for what I would deem medium density body hair. I fell for the adds and got a Bodygroom (BG). Previously, when starting from scratch, I would typically use a normal beard trimmer (with no attachments- i.e. the shortest setting) on dry body hair, and then in the shower, shave the short stubble with a normal safety razor (e.g. gillette). This did the job, but I was optimistic that the BG would be faster and easier, as its design suggests it should be able to do what the other two were doing in one fell swoop. Not so. Having tried wet and dry (both of which its purportedly capable of handling) with treatment and without, I can say it scrapes and scratches if not held just so, and requires numerous passes over one area to to get it smooth, leaving patches of hair of all manor of lengths in the interim. In its attempt to be a razor of all trades, it's a master of none. It fails to be an effective trimer, and it fails to be a smooth electric razor. Save your money for a decent trimmer and good quality razor blades, or keep saving and just get waxed or lazer ;-p

  131. It's a sensitive subject, about shaving sensitive areas. The Bodygroom has some good points and some bad.<br /><br />It does shave, and pretty much delivers results like an electric shaver for your face, but for your body. That is to say, it won't work well on longer hairs, but is good for upkeep. The first few times you use it, you'll miss a lot and it won't seem very close. That improves over time, just like a 'standard' electric razor you might use on your face.<br /><br />I love the fact it's water-resistant.<br /><br />I found the guards difficult and ineffective, but I haven't tried them much.<br /><br />My biggest complaint?<br /><br />Well, I bought it to shave the lower part of the shaft of my penis and my testicles (well, scrotum I guess, since that's on the outside). Notoriously difficult to shave with a razor. I was really looking forward to not having to razor my parts anymore.<br /><br />This cut me. Twice.<br /><br />Now, I've \\"figured it out\\". Somewhat surprising me, it was on the shaft and not my sack (which I would have figured to be more susceptible, given the nature of the skin). It had to do with my \\"angle of approach\\" and the swiftness/firmness of my pressure. I've corrected for that, and no longer had any gouges taken out of my penis. That's a good thing.<br /><br />So I give it three stars, in all fairness, trying not to weigh to heavily the fact that it cut one of my more tender areas. It actually works quite well once your skin acclimates and you learn to use it properly. I've had no trouble with it, nor the battery, at all.

  134. As a proud owner of three or four (lost count) bodygroomers in eight months, I think I have assessed the overall performance of this product. In short, the product works, and does not tear up your nut sack as one review indicated. The shave is close, but this hunk of junk breaks in a variety of ways. Now, the first shave is obviously uncomfortable because your body is not used the rigors of electric razors hitting those special spots. (Using a scissor or side burn shaver to take out long body hair is a real good idea, as the bodygroomer's strength is being sensitive and shaving close rather than taking out large quantities of hair.) You get a real strange feeling after the first shave. However, my skin got used to it rather quick and the more often you shave the less irritation you get. The product takes out chest and ab hair easily, and same with the butt. However, one has to acquire a little bit of skill to negotiate the bean bag. Product shaves the butt good too! Have no idea about the back because I have no hair there but probably have to stretch like you do with your bar of soap/body sponge in the shower. But after some practice this is done easily. The battery last for fifty minutes, so if you use it until it is dead you pretty much only have to charge it once a week. For a closer shave, use a product like Lectric shave on the areas you will shave before you shave, and rubbing alcohol on the parts you shaved after you are done to reduce irritation. (I could see how this is painful but once you get over putting blades on your sack...) The part that sucks about this product is that it is such typical made in China junk. I have had not one of these that lasted two years, as they usually become unusable after two to three months. The foil head can break and try to slip its way off slowly which is bad. Another is that the head slowly detaches more easily from the unit until the point it falls out. It's one thing if you got a good year or twoout of it, but I have returned a bunch of these to Walmart already for a full refund, only to walk out with a new bodygroom. One has never lasted long enough to test whether or not it was truly maintenance free. Well, life was easier when shaving body-hair was considered \\"gay,\\" but now since we live in a world where the girls go to spankwire too, and they expect their guys to look like the dudes on the videos and have no body hair down there. Since I don't want to pay to get my pal waxed, this product will have to do. Hopefully Norelco loses a ton of money on the returns that way they create a more durable version of the product. + It works, it really does + The comb attachments make for a good blade protector for travel - Breaks really fast P.S. And hey, if anyone here owned a bodygroomer for multiple years. Leave a comment, how do I get this thing to last a decent amount of time?

  144. The reason I rated this shaver so low is the amount of aggravation it has given me. It will get the job done if you have an extreme amount of patience, but it will take a long time. The problem lies in the foil/trimmer design. It works fine for the first FEW uses, but it quickly becomes dull and multiple strokes will be necessary to cut down any hair. However, the largest fault by far in its design is that the plastic snap that holds it in place will quickly become ineffective at keeping the trimmer head attached. This means that whenever I try to trim anything, even something as simple as my jawline, the head will undoubtedly pop off at least a handful of times and fall to the floor. Trimming areas other than your face with more complex geometry will make this problem even worse. Trimming armpit hair can sometimes become a Herculean task. Get used to this feeling. If you own this shaver prepare to be bending over time and time again to pick the trimmer head off the floor and reattach it before continuing, until it pops off yet again 10 seconds later. Sometimes the foil even comes off when it hits the floor and I get to reassemble the head itself before putting it back on the shaver. Now you might think that this is one bad experience with one of their shavers, but I managed to get a replacement from their customer service dept (which is actually pretty helpful if you choose your words carefully) and have owned 4 of their trimmer heads and the 2 shavers for about 3 years. The problems I explained occur with both of my shavers and all of the trimmer heads shortly after using them for the first time. If you want to spend $10 a month replacing trimmer heads, go for it, but that will hardly solve the problem since the clasp on the shaver itself will also become dull and unable to hold onto the trimmers no matter how new they are. Long story short, if you want to get a headache every time you use your shaver like I do, go ahead and get this thing.

  146. Summery: This product is great when used for intended purpose, however its cheap construction means it has a limited life span. PROS: *** It is gentle and easy to use on very hard to reach places. CONS: *** After about 2 years of use the button broke, stuck in the depressed position, meaning I can no longer turn the thing on. *** Its great for soft body hair, not great for anything above the neck. REVIEW: Initially this seemed like a great purchase, it shaves reasonably close but at no danger of nicking the skin no matter what awkward angle you use. It seems simple and sturdy and easy to clean. No one wants details as to where and how this product was used, but I will say if you're hoping for a multitasking razor this isn't it. I would occasionally use this guy to trim my beard when I had one, and it worked okay, but sometimes snag the larger hairs, needed multiple passes, etc. This isn't a big deal, I think you need the right tools for the job and prefer this being a good body hair trim and sub-par beard trimmer than having something that was average at both. What really lost stars was the product's history of breaking through no fault of the user. Unfortunately, even though it feels pretty sturdy and reliable it WILL end up breaking. Now I know nothing last forever, but I think for an electronics device that costs $40 that one only gently uses for a few minutes every week, it should be functional or repairable for more than a couple years. Sadly Norelco is the only company that makes body hair razors that seem to work well, so I replaced my broken trimmer with a more expensive one hoping it lasts longer. I don't feel good, though, about endorsing Norelco with a repeat purchase.
  147. I purchased this tool with the intent of making certain parts of my anatomy as hairless as one could reasonably expect from an electric razor. Initially, it was a bit difficult to use, and after two months it hasn't gotten much easier. I've tested it on a great many parts while trying to get the hang of it; it works reasonably well on my chest, underarms, and even legs. However, it has great difficulty on the key areas that most men are probably purchasing this to shave. I've tried different directions, different strokes, different angles, and in the end I always end up with a fairly shoddy shave that took way longer and way more effort than it should have. The inability of this razor is frequently highlighted when I'm trying to focus on a single hair of reasonable length that, even with effort and focus, it simply can't cut. Other problems include the frequency of nicks and cuts I've had with the device; considering the sensitivity of the landscape this device was made for, it really is underwhelming how easily it can would you, and due to this the user must take extra care (which equates to extra time) when they groom. Additionally, just today my foil became dislodged slightly, and due to the construction of the piece it will be impossible to fix; I've never had a problem with a foil on any other shaver, so this is a first. On the upside, when using the guards, trimming seems to go very well...so if you don't want to go for a hairless look, I would actually recommend this product.

  173. I purchased the Bodygroom 2020 on Amazon about 2 years ago. Still have it. The product does what it says. My method is to apply baby powder first to absorb any excess moisture on the area to be shaved and I get a much smoother result. For shaving the bean bag, it is important to pull the skin tautly otherwise nicks can occur. Nobody wants blood in their undies. My body hair is fine and not coarse. I used it about every month or two during that time, and was mostly happy with it throughout. Without the attachment combs, this razor works well for very short or light hair. I used it in the shower once or twice, with so-so results as far as cutting hair consistently. With the attachments, longer hair gets caught between the razor and the comb and has to be brushed out every few minutes, which was pretty annoying. It also tended to pull with the combs on, which was not cool. When it finally gave up the ghost, its death was because the razor screen tore. Not sure what it caught on or how it happened, but once the screen ripped, the jagged metal edge stuck out so I had to stop using it and never bothered to get a new screen. Replaced it by using a regular electric clipper, which cuts longer hair better and more consistently.
  176. this is my second shaver as the first one quit after being dropped to many times. It would no longer hold a charge and was very hard to switch on and off. You also must take your time and go over areas several times to get a smooth shave. It also has a long charging time (8 hours) for a short shaving time (55 minutes approx).   185. I have mixed feelings for this product. I got it way back in 2006, wanting to get rid of my hairy, ahem, bottom. The first use was a bit of a disaster since I didn't read the instructions well and didn't understand how to use the different combs and ended up trimming off more than I should have. I went overboard, and ultimately, to even things out, I had to shave off everything (arms, legs) which made me the butt of jokes from my roommates, and their friends (men and women alike). Anyways, once I learned how to use it properly, I started loving it. I used it on shoulders, back, buttocks, thighs, chest and abs. Couldn't muster the courage to use it on the pubes though, so stuck with a pair of scissors for that. Using it is easier, takes less time and painless if you use it more often (say once in 2 weeks). If you restart in a month, it will take longer and shaving longer hair can be a little painful. What's bad? 1- The foil-cutter piece came out of the head while shaving a few times (partly because I was using it on hair that was too long). 2- In less than a year, the foil got damaged so I had to buy another foil-cutter piece (about 10 bucks I think). 3- The power button started behaving weirdly. Sometimes it would stay depressed and cause the thing to not charge. Sometimes, while charging on the stand, it would start automatically, making a buzzing sound in the middle of the night. 4- In a little over a year, it started losing charge like crazy. Every grooming session, I would need to keep re-charging, making a 15-minute process a 1.5 hour process. In short, I was disappointed in the quality, but liked the functionality. Re-investing in the same product seemed stupid, but I was hooked to the idea of shaving everywhere. So, upon reading more reviews, I got the new model, BG2030 [[ASIN:B001E0C9LI Philips Norelco BG2030 Professional BodyGrooming System]] . It cost only a little more, but has been great so far. BG2030 is all black, is much sleeker, and has separate interchangeable heads (not just separate combs) for shaving vs. trimming. It includes two size-adjustable combs - one for longer hair and one for sensitive areas. Finally, with 2030, I was able to muster the courage to use it on pubes, and it works very well. Oh, and the power button is redesigned too, so it doesn't depress and switch on on it's own anymore. So skip this older model, and get the BG2030 instead.
  186. This is a wonderfull shaver and does an excellent job removing hair on every part of the body. It is very easy to use and convenient when you choose to remove the unwanted hair. It is well worth the price and much less painful than waxing even if it has to be done more frequently.
  187. This shaver works really well below the neckline as described. The ability to use it in the shower compliments the morning routine without any extra hassle. Trust me, your significant other will greatly appreciate all the parts you can make hair free with this device.
  188. I was very excited about getting this product after reading several positive reviews. I was, however, very disappointed after several unsuccessful uses. The trimmer works fine, but the shaving process is near impossible to do in a time efficient manner. It only gets a close shave against the grain (which would be fine but if you don't go against the grain it hardly gets anything done). It also takes way too many strokes to get a close shave in one spot and this leads to irritation post shave. After spending a half an hour in the shower I was able to get a close shave on the abs (skin irritation included), but the contours of my chest were near impossible for this thing to properly shave. After all the reviews of how easy this thing is to use I am curious if I got defective one or if there is something I'm missing about how to use it, but all in all, this product has not done what it is supposed to for me.

  204. Going through these reviews, I see a few of those that have complaints of pulling, etc. How fast where you trying to go? Like the instructions say, if you have alot of hair, use scissors first, take your time with the trimmer & go in different directions as hair doesn't grow just one way. Is it as close as a blade ? No. But there are certain areas that you don't want to use a blade, & there it excels. As far as the attachments, I never use them, they just went into the drawer. The one drawback is that when the battery expires, it just stops without any warning. Not too great when you're only halfway done. Like the design, like the strap as it's helpful unless you're a contortionist. Update October 2009- The shaving head comes off too easily. If only the slightest amount of resistance is used say around the shoulder blades it pops right off which can be frustrating.   209. I had the bodygroom to two years and like many reviewers wasn't overly impressed with the quality. It seems like the entire bunch of body groomers aren't really taken seriously. Like the braun cruzer to this one.. it always looks like we were just getting a what's the 'best of the bunch' situation. When you first pick up the bodygroomer it feel light and cheaply made. It looks nice though. Still it was adequate.. the battery runs out fairly quickly depending on use.. I'd probably call myself a light user... one day the button simply broke, and the razor was stuck in an 'on' position (about a 1 1/2 year of use). I had to tear off the rubber covering on the button a use a pair of tweezers to flip the switch and turn it off internally. It still worked so I kept using it. The the rasor head began to constantly pop off when I was using it. The razor was useless. I threw it out. I searched online and couldn't find anything decent and then I happened to stumble across 'gold' at the department store and never looked back. The called it a all-in-one trimmer but just re-branded it as the Groomsman plus by Wahl [...] So keep your eye out for it I've been using this thing for over a month and it's just a beast.. meaning great lithium battery life (haven't recharged it yet). and everything you need customize your facial hair to down below. it also includes a nose and ear hair trimmer if you want to use it. It's a decent build and feels sturdy for what you need it for. It's has more power than the norco so it freaked me out when I first when down there.. but it's all good just beware of that. It also has a five year warranty. I don't use many of the attachments, mostly just the razor but price wise you can't beat the quality. Just my two cents.. I'd suggest this razor or almost any other walh. They've really got the 'clipper' down which is what we want. Good Grooming
  210. I like this product but the construction is somewhat less than rugged. The combs clip on easy enough but the whole cutting head comes apart when you try to remove them.   211. This product does exactly what it claims to. It takes care of body hair where you don't want it, and it does so without irritation, rashes or ingrown hairs. I generally use this only on the back of the neck (cleanups between haircuts) and chest, and it's much better than a regualr razor: faster, more effective, safer. Definitely recommended!<br /><br />It gets four out of five because it's a little noisy and the battery (while long lasting) can only be charged when fully drained. However - I have dropped this numerous times in the shower, some of which cause the entire foil and cutting surfaces to become detached from the body of the groomer. I simply re-inserted them back, and it still worked perfectly. Very surprised at the resiliance of this product, and happy, too.
  212. This is a typical Philips product -- great idea, but poor execution.<br /><br />The Bodygroom does everything it promises, and better than anything else I've ever tried. I can shed my winter coat in about the third of the time it used to take me with a sideburn razor.<br /><br />After a few uses, though, the metal foil became bent, and now only one side of the razor is usable. It should be replacable, of course -- even the manual says so. But every time I call or write Philips they tell me the replacement heads aren't available yet.<br /><br />If that wasn't irritating enough, the battery life is really poor, and gets worse every time you use it. You can't run it off A/C power. And there is no battery indicator light on the unit, which just screams of cost-cutting.<br /><br />I'll probably end up buying another Bodygroom since there really isn't any other option. But as soon as I can switch, I will.

  215. I got the Bodygroom to use on my chest hair and it worked perfectly. I chose the #3 comb (.4\\") which made short work of my chest thatch. The hair there is pretty thick, but the Bodygroom didn't have any trouble with it -- I just had to clean out the excess hair a few times. Pecs are way more visible now, looks great. Chose the #2 for my abs with similar results; my six-pack really stands out now. Follow the instructions and only trim dry hair -- the combs can't pick it up as well if it's wet. For the more delicate areas I used the shaver wet, with shave gel. Even on those round surfaces it did a nice job, smooth, with no nicks. Again, great product!
  216. OK the design is decent and looks like an economy shaver but maybe it's too cheap for me ($30). I rather spend over $50 on a better quality body grooming shaver. My main problem is the battery power and performance. It uses NiMH battery and it's not replaceable, so you have to throw the whole shaver when the battery is no good. The manual says it's good for a 50 mins run on a full battery but my experience is more like 10 mins, after that, the shaver becomes less powerful and does not cut thick coarse hair very well, I have many moments when the hair got stuck in the shaver, not a pleasant experience. Secondly. the manual recommends to fully discharge the battery before recharging to prolong battery life, so I let the shaver run until it dies with annoying buzzing sound in the background. Thirdly, a full battery will not hold the charge for long when it's not in use, after a few days, the battery loses power, so you have to wait for the 8 hours charging time each you want to shave. I don't know if I have a defective battery or not. I will have to contact Philips. <br />I want a body groomer with more power so it will not get hair stuck while shaving. Philips should have use a more powerful lithium battery or at least exchangeable AA NiMH battery.
  217. I saw some questionable reviews on this product so was a little hesitant on buying it. Price was fairly high too. The product works well though and I am happy with my purchase.   239. Pretty hairy guy myself. Product works as advertised and leaves me with a nice smooth chest.
  240. This thing cut me up a bit... not as bad as previous electric trimmers/razors I tried, but it's not quite as suited to \\"sensitive areas\\" as they say. The problem is the top and bottom trimmer blades (the ones that are not under the foil) catch your skin (even when you're trying to hold it taut), especially in concave areas. There needs to be a way to turn them off independently of the blades under the foil, and/or the teeth should be much finer (like the little \\"finishing touch\\" shavers) so your skin won't slip in between the teeth. The blades under the foil did not irritate my skin and they made a pretty close shave. Battery: There is no battery meter, and you're not supposed to leave it in the charger 24/7 (because it's NiMH), so there are issues not having enough charge to finish the job (until the next day after you charge it). I'd actually rather just have a NiCd battery for this application (because you can leave them in the charger 24/7, like a Sonicare toothbrush, and it won't hurt the battery life). For the price this is a decent shaver... I'd give it 5 stars if Philips/Norelco could fix the issues I talked about.
  241. I've tried quite a few trimmers for the more sensitive areas of my body, and hadn't had any luck. All of them were prone to catching on and even occasionally (yikes!) cutting sensitive skin.<br />I've now used the Bodygroom Shaver on even the most sensitive areas of body, and it's worked exactly as advertised, with only the most minor of irritation.

  244. This trimmer has served me for years, and for the most part it has worked great. Pros: -100% waterproof and works fine in the shower -Functions as expected as long as you change out the trimmer head every once in a while Cons (after 4+ years of use): -The button to turn on the unit sometimes loses the air inside it, and therefore makes it impossible to turn the unit on/off without opening it up to allow the air back inside. -Related to the strange airtight malfunction the unit sometimes turns on by itself, including in the middle of the night. Being startled by the unit vibrating against the bathroom wall (especially the first time it happened, when I had to go searching for the source of the sound). -After not changing out the head as long as I've owned the unit, the head is no longer tight enough to maintain a strong grip into the unit, and sometimes with upstrokes it falls off. -Due to the trimmer head falling off on the floor, a few teeth have broken off from the blades and the unit now is capable of making painful cuts if not careful. I avoid this by holding the unit at angles such that the broken teeth do not contact my skin. -Attachments are loose and can be lost (as opposed to the newer version, which has it built in). I will be upgrading to the 2040 unit because of the problems that arose, but if they were not present I would see no need to upgrade if you already own this unit.

  256. even though this product is for men i am a woman that uses it on a regular basis. my previous shave was the remington womens wdc7000 wet/dry shaver. i got tired of expenses piling up for cleaning solution and foils and cutters for that model so i decided to give this norelco a try after reading all the great reviews here. it is definitely one of the best shaving products around - it keeps a long charge (longer than the 50 minutes it says it keeps), shaves very well no matter where on the body you're shaving, and it's extremely easy to clean. it does everything i need it to do. the only cons i have about this product (and why it's 4 not 5 stars) - the attachments are useless and the foils are super super delicate and easy to bend even just shaving (creating more chafing than normal) requiring quicker replacement. i would definitely recommend this to anyone looking for an every day shaver or even just a good travel razor that can go in a carry on bag.
  257. This is an excellent value for the price. The only thing that I don't like is there is no battery indicator to tell you when it needs recharging.
  258. I've used it in and out of the shower and feel that it's easier to clean midway through a grooming project in the shower. The sized guards are pointless, as the smallest number one is the only one that effectively trims curly body hair. It takes a few swipes over the same area, but the trimming results are very good, with little to no irritation. With the guard off, I was able to get a pretty close shave with no irritation. That was a huge plus for me. The ergonomics are excellent and the ability to use it in the shower distinguishes it from the rest. I highly recommend this product.

I don't use any of the guards, and find just the razor to be fine. Never had any tugging or pinching issues. While scary at first, product is easy to take apart and clean.   276. I had high hopes for this product but was very disappointed. A fully-charged battery lasts 50 minutes which is not enough time for a guy like me who's only moderately hairy. It takes many, many times of shaving over a spot to get the hair neatly trimmed, and even then sometimes it just won't work. As far as shaving (as opposed to trimming) the groin area safely, it doesn't work very well and the exposed cutting edges at both sides of the foil can cut if you're not careful. <br /> <br />The Norelco Accuvac, which Amazon sells for the same price, is much sturdier and trims body hair much faster and more neatly; it has 9 settings which are changed by turning a dial, as opposed to the cumbersome and hard-to-change 3 plastic attachments that come with the Bodygroom. As far as shaving the groin area, trim with the Accuvac and then use a new style razor such as the Gillette M3 Power or Venus Vibrance; they give a much closer shave and are almost impossible to cut your privates with!

  284. This trimmer is great if you want to shave down to smooth skin, but the trimmer attachments are quite ineffective. (For example, trimming hair down to a uniform quarter or half inch.) The attachments don't do a good job of guiding hair into the actual cutters so you have to make many passes to get all the hair. Even then, the remaining hair isn't an even length. If you want uniformly trimmed hair, you're better off with traditional clippers like the Wahl 9627 (just one example). And watch out -- without the attachments, the Bodygroom has been known to bite in tight areas! But if you want smooth skin without using a razor, this is the device for you.

what, am i supposed to set an alarmfor 8 hours from now to remember to take it off the charger? that and my difficulty with the trimmer are the reasons i give it 4 stars instead of 5. other than that stuff it's a great product!
  319. I was tired of ripping out hairs using a standard facial facial trimmer. I bought this item on a whim based on all the good reviews here on Amazon. So far, I love the product. It's easy to use and very comfortable. No nicking or pulling any hairs in my armpits, chest or groin region. Longer hair may take a few extra passes, but overall the job gets done with great comfort. Cleaning is easy, although I agree caution should be take with the delicate foil cover. I haven't used the plastic trimmer pop-on's. Cons: It would be great to have an LED on the shaver to indicate charging time, and I believe the newer model has this feature but of the course the cost is higher. I also would have appreciated a cover for the head (like most shavers) to prevent any damage to the foil or trimmers. Overall, very satisfied and I would definitely purchase this product again.
  320. I BROUGHT THIS ITEM TO MAKE MYSELF MORE USER FRIENDLY TO MY GIRLFRIEND. MY ADVISE TO YOU IS THIS. SLOW SWEEPS & LOTS OF SOAP & LATHER! IT WILL PULL & IT WILL BITE YOU! EXTRA CAUTION NEEDED AROUND THE FRANKS & BEANS. USE THE GUARD IN THIS AREA UNTIL YOU BECOME MORE PROFICIENT. ANOTHER ITEM I SHOULD MENTION IS DURABILITY. MY SWITCH BROKE IN THE ON POSITION AFTER A YEAR OF USE. BUT I WILL PURCHASE ANOTHER ONE.

This is, without a doubt, the best. Hands down, the best I have ever used. Two things that make it the best. 1. It works \\"down low\\" like nothing else I have ever used, no pain at all, just perfect! 2. It's shower safe. Not sure what else is needed with something like this, what more do you want! :) Nothing else I have ever used could do either of these, so well done Philips.

  325. Like many men today, I have grooming needs beyond what razor or scissors can handle. There's waxing (expensive, messy) but for fast growing body hair, it's simpler to just trim. This shaver does the trick-- it's easy to use, painless, and fast. Mine has been working fine for over 2 years now (using it a couple of times a month), making it a relative bargain.<br /><br />While it's wet/dry safe, wet hair doesn't stick up as much for trimming, and the plastic combs/guards stick a bit to even dry skin, so it's best to use this dry. For safety, I use the shaver w/o a comb only on a few large/flat sections of skin-- needless to say, be careful around sensitive areas.<br /><br />The design of the combs is my primary complaint (for which I deduct 1 star). The plastic sticks to skin that isn't completely dry/flat (eg, the curve of a shoulder), causing the comb to pop off and the foil to bounce off the skin (trimming that spot shorter than intended).<br /><br />Other quibbles: The cutting foil (the \\"blades\\" of the shaver) needs to be replaced when it gets dull, which for me is 1-2x a year. Recharge time is a bit slow. Recently the on-off switch stuck in the \\"on\\" position. I was going to let the battery run down before trying to force the issue, but the button popped back out on its own. Even if the switch had stayed stuck and been unrepairable, I'd have ordered another unit-- it's been that convenient and effective.<br /><br />The replacement foils are a bit expensive for the frequency of replacement, and the grip could be more ergonomic (and the combs could be smoother to use), but for the price this thing works very well. Recommended.
  326. I am very happy with this product. It is much more convenient than using a razor, and gives a fairly close cut. It does not cut quite as close as a razor, but it is easy and quick to keep grooming maintained.
  327. I am very pleased with this new electric shaver. It is better than I expected. Smooth, no pulling, no mess. Good product.
  328. I have now purchased two of these \\"Philips Body Groom Men's Shaver (TT2021)\\" units, and both had the exact same issue occur after only a few uses. The shaving head will eventually start to fall out quite easily when you are using the product. Taking the shaving head off to clean the inside, and popping it back on with a \\"click\\" is what will start the wear, and it doesn't take long. After only about 5 or 6 uses, it will fall off so frequently that it's not worth the frustration to continue the rest of your shave/trim. All it takes is for you to shave at a slight angle, and the head will catch and pop out completely. I had never dropped any of the two units, and used them as designed. Another frustration is that it is nearly impossible to get replacement heads for this product in Canada. You can't find them in any store, because I've tried, and it is also difficult to get online! For some reason, most US sites did not ship this particular product's shaving head replacements to Canada (even Amazon!). I had to land up ordering from an online site from the U.K. if you can believe that. Trying brand new replacement heads does not help the issue of the shaving heads falling off during use. The fault is on the unit's end, not the shaving head's end. I have now bought a third body shaver, but this time, I bought the \\"Philips Body Groom Pro Shaver (TT-2040)\\". Thankfully it appears that all the replacement heads I ordered from the U.K. will also work with this new unit as well! It is on its first charge right now, and I've already tried taking the shaving head off and on, and was pleased to find out it was a lot more difficult! Also, the pivoting head will allow for better performance around curves and contours. It appears that Philips engineers may have known about this shortcoming, and fixed it with a superior model that was only released this year (2010). It definitely seems like its worth the extra money!
  329. While it worked, it was OK. A little more expensive than it was worth, I've had cheaper shavers that did a better job, but overall it gave a decent shave. I always had to go back over everything with a closer shaver, so it was more one of a two-piece, otherwise it left behind extremely prickly hairs. Even at a full charge, it tended to get jammed up fairly often, you'd have to keep going over a section over and over and even then you'd miss a few straggling hairs. It works about as well on the face as on the body, so I don't know why the package warns you to never use it for such. A good face shaver would also probably be a better body shaver. Despite being marketed to men, I have a feeling that it would only work well for a woman's softer hair; if you have thick body hair it's just overwhelmed too often. The head shape especially causes it to collect hairs in a bunch at the blade, leading to jams, and the foil doesn't seem to be useful; I always ended up using the blade trimmer almost exclusively.<br /><br />After about a year, the front button just up and quit on me. The rubber button simply stuck in, either it lost a spring or the rubber seal got old somehow. I managed to get it on with pulling it out with pliers one time - and had a hell of a time getting it back off - but after that, nothing. Worthless trash.

  339. This groomer works quite well overall. The blade does get clogged pretty quickly if you've gone awhile without trimming, but flip it over and shake it and the clog falls away. The foil will never trim as well as a blade, but that shortcoming is hardly limited to this device. It takes multiple passes over body hair to get everything trimmed, but it will get them all eventually. As far as a usable body groomer, this does a decent job. My complaint is I'm on my second in 18 months, and will likely be my last, as I'm on a search for a different device. The battery is garbage. I use a Norelco shaver for my face, and it's battery lasts years and years. Use it to full discharge, recharge full and you're ready for 3 more weeks. Not the Body Groom. It seems this battery is only good for a dozen charges or so before it can't last 5 minutes. Both Body Grooms I've had exhibit this exact behavior. Norelco does a great job with batteries in their shavers, why not in this? No idea, but I'm tired of reaching for it, turning it on, and having it die in 60 seconds.

I have highly sensitive skin, and traditional razors cut too close to the skin, which makes it irritated. This means I have to wait at least a week or two before I can shave again with a traditional razor.   356. This thing is awesome! I was a bit skeptical at first i must say....i have used other shavers in the past on those \\"sensitive\\" areas below the waistline, and have broken out in rashes and bumps,nicks and cuts and have not gotten close shaves before. But even the first time i tried the Bodygroomer, i was impressed...first off...there was no rash...no nicks or cuts, it was the closest shave iv'e ever had before, and i used it on my family jewels first with a little fear..but after a few seconds...with no fear at all! just plain pressure..no worries. <br />On a full charge it has more than enough power to do the job necessary for more than 1 shave job, even for a gorrilla, but i usually charge it between shaves just to be safe. It can be used in the shower so it says, but i havent tested out that feature...dry shave gets more done for me personnaly. It cleans up really well..the head pops off ...I'm talking about the razor part of the bodygroom, for cleaning...you can run it under water, and clean it with a brush (included) and then rinse off the body of the unit under water as well, then dry off the whole thing....then recharge it on the included stand..which is pretty nifty looking on your dresser. The razor part of the bodygroomer has a foil part in the middle of it which is smooth for the close up sensitive parts of your body..you know which ones were talkin bout here....come on...think about what a squirrell eats....,then it also has on the top and bottom part of the razor unit a piece that sort of extends up and a piece that extends down sort of like those old norelco shavers that had those pop up sideburn trimmers on the backside of the electric shavers. these extestions are for trimming the hedges...or the rough grassy areas of your forest. It does a superb job i must say. All in all, I give this unit an A+ for 2 reasons, 1: It works great , as advertised. and 2: the cost factor, it's not that expensive. Especially for a product that actually does the job on your private parts. Hope you found this helpfull. Enjoy!!

Now, I'd never done anything like this before, and let me tell you, I'm hairier'n a Wookiee. A real walking carpet. So when I got the Bodygroom I charged it up and had at. A few minutes later, the \\"rug\\" was gone and I had some nice hardwood floors, if'n you know what I mean. And it was a comfortable, easy process. Not a nick or a cut anywhere, and not a moment's discomfort, even when clearing the undergrowth on some, shall we say, rather sensitive areas. Well, what can I say. I like the way I look now. Hopefully anyone in a position to look likes it too. :-) And the ease of using this shaver is going to make \\"buildings and grounds\\" maintenance as easy as the shave I give my face every day. My only disappointment is the lack of a charging status light on either the unit or the charger base. Since there's not a real positive \\"click\\" when the unit slides into the base, some sort of confirmation that you're indeed charging the battery--and of when it's fully charged--would be nice. But that's a fairly minor flaw in an otherwise high-quality appliance. So yeah: Total n00b takes unfamiliar appliance to sensitive parts of his body, performs unfamiliar procedure, gets good results. It doesn't get much better'n that, folks. Definitely recommended.
  365. The GOOD: -Charges quickly -Easy to clean -Easy to use -Can be used wet or dry The BAD: -Takes a few passes to get all the hairs -Not the easiest to use in tight spaces -Edge trimmers can be... awkward No point in beating around the bush here; I got this trimmer to help keep my private parts in pristine condition. The edge trimmers are great for tackling long hair before you really buff it up with the, umm, buzzer? (Not sure what to call the main cutting surface with the foil guard.) I've cleaned up my pits, chest, and naughty bits and am mostly pleased. It does a good job cutting through the big stuff, but seems to struggle with lighter hair (think peach-fuzz). My only other complaint is that it's a bit too big to really get in the tight spaces (between my beanbag and leg) without sitting in some weird yoga pose that exposes my goodies to the world. Haven't used the guards, so I can't comment there. This trimmer will NOT replace a normal razor (it doesn't cut THAT close), but it is a good maintenance tool. Recommended: Yes

I have never in my life tried to trim my butt hair, I'm talking about the hair in the crack. You know, the cause of the thirty wipes rather than one or two after you take a crap. I took this thing in the shower, and due to the fact that it has clippers on both sides, I was able to just run it along my crack and POW, it was gone. This thing has rounded clipper teeth which means no pain. Try trimming your crack or testicles with any other clipper...
