  387. I can't say I had any problem with the actual performance of this device. Good battery life, very close shave on sensitive regions with no cutting/pulling, etc. Doesn't work quite as well in the shower as it does dry, but it gets the job done. And while it doesn't shave thick facial hair well (it isn't supposed to!), it works fabulously to trim sideburns or trim down other facial hair before using a good old razor. My one and only complaint is that after about 10 months of using it twice a week, the button that turns it on and off just... broke off leaving it stuck on the on position. Still, $40 for a razor that lasted as long as it did isn't a bad deal and I know I got my moneys worth out of it. I'll be more careful with the next one, as should other buyers. The switch that turns it on is extremely tiny and all it would take to rip it off the circuit board is moving your finger slightly when you press it on.
  388. Pros - Performed as indicated and easy to use below the neck for any area. Sensitive areas requires a little common sense and caution but performed well overall. Very satisfied and sturdy design. Dropped it once and the shaving mechanism popped out. Placed it back easily and the shaver performed well without any ill effects. Cons - requires 8 hours to achieve full charge with less than one hour operation time. Efficient shaver so it is tolerable negative.
  389. Now before I sound any more like a teenage girl, here's the bottom line. The Bodygroom is a waste of money. I have never written negative reviews for anything and it's a shame that Philips had to break that spell. I wish I had kept my receipt so I could return it, but being that I've never been disappointed by neither Philips or Norelco, I threw it out. I simply cannot understand the good reviews on this site. They must be somehow connected to the brilliant people that put out the ad campaign. Who knows. Back to the product: Looks nice and that's about it. It barely cuts anything, when it does, hair gets trapped between the blue plastic attachment which means that you constantly have to take it off and rinse it. That would sort of be ok, if the whole head (cutter blades) didn't come out as well. Even with the lightest touch, it still feels like you're breaking it and I'm sure one of these days it will surely do just that. Here's the worst part, even if advertised as working fine in the shower, it will hurt as hell, as your hair will get caught in it, so every 5 seconds you'll be going 'ouch' 'ouch' 'ouch' You get my point. So try it on dry hair - doesn't hurt as much but still doesn't cut. The design is itself very poor. If you look at the blades under the very fragile (sic!) foil, they're basically vertical semi-circle blades at a moving left-right-left at a very fast speed. Well, they're not fast nor sharp enough. Again, it will catch your hair. And it will hurt. The attachments are also a joke. The numbers don't really correspond the ones at the barber's, but they go up to a 5!!! Now if I can't really cut medium length hair from my sensitive areas with a 1, what the hell am I gonna do with a 5? Surely this was meant for Geico's cavemen. I could go on and on. Do yourself a favor, keep the receipt, or even better spend $20 on a Conair trimmer that will cut 20 times better. This is just plainly bad. Really bad. And if any Philips people are reading this, I want my money back. Pretty please.

It wouldn't come off. I was quite worried about breaking the comb since there's no place to apply enough pressure to release it from the shaver (it seemed to me). Again, I was being as careful as I could and had just about given up when...Suddenly, the head of the shaver came off with the comb still attached. Aargh...but no big deal, right? Wrong! The shaver head attaches to the shaver body via small plastic pieces that were now broken. I was amazed this could happen so easily. I've owned many Braun facial hair shavers and nothing like that has occurred with those.   438. This item is very cheaply made. The foil is only held in by four pin head-size \\"dots\\" while snapping into the head. Also, the combs attach in a very similar snap-on and hold with dot concept. They are difficult to get on/off. I have only used this maybe ten times, and now the foil starts falling out all the time. The dots fail to hold it any more. Without the combs, it is too \\"dangerous\\" for trimming sensitive areas. With the combs, it is too clunky/bulky, and you have to go over the area about ten times. I found an old electric Wahl-type trimmer (with combs) works a lot better and faster. Finally, the charger base is a stupid waste of space and plastic and often the contacts don't work unless you really pay attention or jiggle it. A conventional plug would have been a lot better. I also have the Philips Norelco grooming kit and really like that one, but this cost me almost triple, and it is falling apart after much less usage.
  439. I bought this product quite some time ago. The commercials made it look awesome, however, it really didn't do that great of job with respect to manscaping. Eventually the push-button failed and I replaced it with a waterproof philips beard-groomer.
  440. This is just a terrible shaver. I bought it primarily for my stomach, chest and under arms. It is really slow. I had to go over the same body area 5-10 times, really slowly in order for it to cut all the hair. On areas such as my stomach it wasn't too bad since the skin there is smooth but on areas like under arms or the chest area it was a nightmare. It barely cut the hair, took for ever and left a stubble. Not very smooth. Before when I used a manual razor, it took me around 3 minutes to shave my stomach and chest and with this electric shaver, it took like 10 minutes and it was nowhere as close as with the manual shaver. After 3 weeks I called Philips and told them I wanted to return it. I got the 45-day money back guarantee form and I will drop off the shaver in the mail tomorrow.
  441. The damn top comes off at the slightest provocation. It does the job, if you are willing to put up with constantly having to stop, retrieve, and replace the top. The combs are pointless.

  446. Saw the ad for the product in Men's Health and decided to check it out. In my opinion not only Philips did a great job with the ad but also with the product. Though you have to be still careful it is way ahead of anything in the market I have used it terms of design and safety. The only improvement I could think of would be more power to the motor and/or sharper blades since at rare times it does appear to pull on the hair. Overall a great product and I would definitely recommend it over others.
  447. I ordered this on a whim. And boy am I glad. This is a great product. This is just what I was looking for. It does the job and without irritation. No bumps, no redness. Just smoothness. This is a great product.
  448. This product is well worth its $35. It mostly gets the job done. The design is attractive, cleaning is real easy, the charge stays on for weeks (assuming you don't use it daily). There are only 2 things to mention in a negative way: <br />1. My wife said she couldn't position the shaver properly when shaving my neck. If positioned vertically, the bottom of the bulky handle ends up touching a point on the back between the shoulderblades. This obviously affects the smoothness of the motion. <br />2. The shave is not as close as from using regular blades, but I guess this could be said of any electric shaver.   451. This device is great! I was initially skeptical about using it as if I wasn't shaving anything that important, you know, the way commercials like to hype things. Any way, I decided to take NO CHANCES, so this is how I obtained excellent results with absolutely NO problems!<br /><br />1. I carefully shaved the excess hair with one of the included guides in order to prevent any pulling.<br /><br />2. I took the guide off and after very careful and controlled strokes, with the edger, I shaved off as much of the remaining hair as possible.<br /><br />3. Finally, I had the aluminum foil take over and everything was pretty much downhill after that, because this thing did an amazingly close and pain free, literally right down to the bare skin job with absolutely no pulling, cuts or even irritation.<br /><br />I highly recommend this shaver and I can assure you that it will take a few years off from your best friends and you as well! My wife loved the new look and so did I!

  453. If you are insecure about the body grooming process and are not comfortable about his subject \\"STOP READING THIS NOW\\". This was meant for informational purposes only. <br /> <br />Yes, the rumors are true...I am now the proud owner of the Norelco \\"Bodygroom\\". And let me just say this \\"A+ Norelco, well done\\". Now lets get into my formal review of the product. <br /> <br />Appearance: Very nice, comes with a charging stand...fits in your hand nicely...easy to hold on to at awkward angles. Trimmer guards are a nice clear bright blue color...easy to find in the messiest of drawers. They are easy to pop on, however they can be stubborn to get off. <br /> <br />Underarm Hair: <br /> This area was the most time consuming...the product did its job, however I would use it in conjunction with something a little more beefy to knock it down first...this is probably a first time only concern as follow-up jobs will be much easier. <br /> <br />Chest and Ab Hair: <br /> No problems, a very nice look obtained with the number 2 guard. <br /> <br />Groin: <br /> Lets just say the \\"Bodygroom\\" is Shaft, Beanbag, and Starfish safe. No nicks or any pain...no worries...that does not mean go in there like a maniac...take your time...the two trimmers on the front and back(allow for push or pull stroke) knock down the forest while the foil on top produced nice smooth skin...Like any shaving product redness and skin irritation are inevitable (24 hrs later), however I noticed that the skin irritation was only about one third that of standard Mach 3 shave. The skin irritation was limited to the inner thighs (Shaft, Beanbag, and Starfish showed no signs of irritation)....Here is a word of warning, if you are a hairy man in the posterior / back (buttocks cheeks) region, I would not suggest going bald there...although the bodygroom does yield very smooth results, re-growth maybe a little annoying. <br /> <br />All in All the boodygroom is a great product and offers a safe way to prep those sensitive areas. I can not at this time give you a female perspective on this product...I can only assume that it will yeild similar results...I will keep you informed of any new developments.

  479. I've never used a body shaver before so I don't have anything to compare this with, but while I found the Bodygroom ultimately functional, it's still a frustrating and annoying product to use. I've mainly used the Bodygroom just to trim up. I did try to \\"clean shave\\" south of the border there a few times and ended up with some painful results. I would not recommend that. If you're going to try, make sure you keep that skin extremely taut. Despite my best efforts, I ended up getting the skin caught down there. Not pretty. So I decided to not bother with any further \\"clean shave\\" attempts and just stuck with trimming. As a trimming tool it's fairly adequate. My number one biggest complaint with it is those guard attachments that pop off quite easily. Whenever I'm trying to trim, those guards snap off if you apply too much pressure or you catch some skin. Mainly this has just been a problem trimming the armpits. Less so in other areas. It's very frustrating though as they snap off quite frequently in those \\"trouble areas.\\" I don't think I've ever cursed so much... It will run for about an hour to forty five minutes with a full charge. You'll probably need it though. Like other reviewers have said, you do have to go over the hair multiple times to trim it all down. I usually end up going through the whole charge trimming everything. Supposedly you can use it wet but I would assume that's only for clean shaving and not trimming. If your hair is all wet and matted down there's no way this is going to trim it. I also have to charge mine up right before using it. (It takes about 8 hours to charge so you have to plan ahead.) If I don't, it loses the charge pretty quickly. (Maybe within a day or so.) The first few months I used it the battery would keep the charge for a decent amount of time. But that diminished after a few months of use. I guess in some way that's to be expected but the dropoff seems pretty extreme. I've had other electric (facial) shavers that seemed to have much better battery life. All in all, I guess it gets the job done if you stick with trimming, but it's definitely a P.I.T.A. If there were any comparable competitive products I would definitely check them out and consider switching up. I do see they have a higher end model [[ASIN:B0037HP9OA Philips Norelco BG2040/34 Philips Norelco Bodygroom Pro Grooming System, Black / Silver]] with an adjustable guard. I would hope that since it's using that instead of multiple detachable guards it would stay on a little more securely. I hate to recommend spending more money on this product, but if I was choosing between them I would probably go for the higher end model to hopefully alleviate the frequent guard detachment issue.

  490. This product works exactly as it says it will. I was pretty skeptical, but it gives a close shave with minimal irritation. And no exposed blades to snag sensitve bits.<br />Being able to use it in or out of the shower is a real plus, though it seems to work better dry.<br /><br />Update:<br />With the amount of hair I have, I guess it's no surprise that this thing won't last a life time. I dropped my first BG one too many times in the shower and it finally gave out.<br />Of course this product is so great at what it does, that it was a no brainer to replace it.<br />The only complaint I have about the BodyGroom is how delicate the foil guard is. It is very easy to get bent or dented, and when that happens, you can get some unexpected snagging from the cutting blades. The best way to prevent any damage to the foil (which incidentally, is not covered by the warranty), is to be very careful when removing and disassembling the unit to clean it.<br /><br />Now in terms of performance--this thing can plow through a lot of hair, but works better if you keep up with your trimming regularly. If you are doing a particular hairy part, like your legs, clip them dry and be sure to tap out the hair that gets caught up in the shaver head regularly.<br /><br />The guards are basically useless and will frustrate you if you are trying to do any type of styling (say, shaved down to the skin on your torso, but leaving a little longer happy trail). More times than not, I just ditch the guards and take it all o<br /><br />The angle of the head makes it easy to reach all areas on my back. Yeah, I know, back hair. Hey, why do you think I bought this thing?
  491. I want to start this review by saying, I love this item. I want to then say, I don't believe there is a product out there yet that doesn't hurt a little in certain places - even a regular manual razor can cause some discomfort in places. Also, I think this product, though it potentially trims everything should be used in combination with other items. I also use a G-290 and a straight edge razor. That being said the Bodygroom did an EXCELLENT job anywhere I used it. Conventional trimmers/clippers cannot be used underarms or around groin areas because the teeth are too wide apart. It will actually pull the skin and can cut. The Bodygroom has much, much smaller teeth and while there are still places I wouldn't try it out, it handles other spots like underarms and PARTS of the groin area with no issues. For $40, it's entirely worth the money. EDITED 5/22/06 - So many negative review on here talk about their facial hair. Let's see... the website, the owner's manual, the box itself... hmmm. EVERYTHING tells you this is for below the neck hence the name \\"BODYGROOM\\". It sucks to see negative reviews from people that are too ignorant to read before they use. Use this on your body, and use it properly and you'll be very happy with the results.
  492. Our adopted son Sam has what he considers to be an embarrassing problem: excessive body hair. We think it is quite normal, since he is a chimpanzee, but Sam wants to appear as human as possible in order to blend into human society. <br /> <br />We got the Philips Norelco BG2020 Men's Bodygroom for Sam because nothing else we tried worked to his and our satisfaction. Electric clippers snagged on and pulled his shaggy fur. Shears simply took too long and nearly gave me and my wife carpal tunnel syndrome. The Bodygroom did the trick, both cutting and shaving the hair with minimal fuss. We found that cutting slowly in the direction of the hair worked best. Frequent cleaning of cut hairs from the trimmer blades kept hair-pulling to a minimum. Fortunately for Sam, his long simian arms allow him to reach most of his body, but my wife and I still help him with his back. <br /> <br />Our bodygroomed Sam is now going to business school. The people there have no idea that he is a chimpanzee, despite the fact that Sam can't read or write. In fact, he is doing quite well and is at the top of his class. Sam wants to eventually go into advertising or politics, but either way, we know he'll go far.
  493. This little shaver is great for those of you who have found a reason why you might want to trim areas you'd never thought of trimming before.<br /><br />I'm in Baghdad, Iraq and the heat here is absolutely awful. I sit in an air conditioned box all day typing. However, I am constantly having to get up and go talk to people who are outside in a one story parking garage. When you go from 72 degrees to 105 or higher on a constant basis, your body does weird things like sweat profusely followed by freeze drying into a sticky paste. It's fairly disgusting and unhygenic.<br /><br />Needless to say, I purchased this product to try and minimize the added heat and feeling of stickiness caused by the constant environment change.<br /><br />The Bodygroom itself does a good job of trimming and gets pretty close the skin without any nicks or tugging. It works fine in both pits and the groin area, which are the two that were mostly bothering me, since I'm not very hairy elsewhere.<br /><br />If you're looking for a super close shave, this product alone won't do it. It did get close enough to eliminate chafing and itching without any cutting or pinching, so I'm impressed with what it does for the price.<br /><br />Update: Don't drop it. I dropped my Bodygroom from a height of about 6 feet (hanging on a nail in my hooch) and the plastic casing cracked. It still works with some liberal application of duct tape. Oops!
  494. Until the Bodygroom arrived, the only choices for men (or for that matter women) who wanted to shave more than legs or underarms, were expensive, poorly-performing electric \\"body shavers\\" that cost $50 and up.<br /><br />I wasn't positive that Norelco's entry into this area would be any better. Their regular razors always irritated my face (I use a Braun for my face), so I wasn't sure a body entry wouldn't irritate my sensitive skin. Since they have a 90-day money-back gaurantee, I decided to give it a try.<br /><br />I am happy to report that the shaver doesn't irritate my skin at all, does a great job on both long and short hair, and works exactly as advertised. I am particularly fond of the plastic trimmer attachements which let me tame some long hair without removing it all. Cleanup is a quick rinse under the faucet.<br /><br />While this shaver does work in the shower, I discovered that wet skin has a lot more friction than dry skin. The shaver was a lot easier to use on dry skin. All in all, this product does everything it claims to do. The value is very good, and the quality is excellent. By the way, Norelco has a cute web site advertising this product (that's how I found it. The Wall Street Journal wrote the web site up), [...].
  495. Someone had to be adventurous. Wonder now more. It even works on THAT area! Soft as a baby's bottom with little to no effort or pain.
  496. This product is by far the best out there for men who like a cleaned up apperance. We are in the day and age of a well groomed man and norelco embraced it and made a machine that does the job. Best $40 I have ever spent on grooming supplies. <br /> <br />No Snags, cuts or razor burn. It for sure says in the manual that you are not suspossed to use it on your face or scalp. So those idiots who bought this and are using it for that should not be making bad comments against this wonderful product. <br /> <br />I just dont like body hair and always try to keep it under control and for the first time I do not think that it will be a tedious chore since this works so easy. <br /> <br />Highly recommended
  497. I started to use my new Philips Bodygroom today, and I am really impressed. This device is excellent to remove body hair in delicate areas without having to sweat bullets while doing it. It's perfect for removing pubic hair, perianal hair, leg hair, chest hair, etc., many of which I have been shaving and buzzing for over a decade using vastly inferior devices. I have no idea why there aren't dozens of comparable units for body trimming like there are for beard maintenance and facial shaving because there are many of guys, like me, who don't like body hair at all.
  498. The Bodygroom is alright at best. I bought it mainly because of the flashy advertising (claiming its the bee's knee's when it comes to shaving down under ... it's not), and the good reviews that it got on this site. I think I'll be the first 'educated' bad review, being that the other bad reviews came from people who generally did not follow the directions, tried to use it to shave their face, etc. The basics are this: if you're already shaved and you want to use it to maintain, then it 'can' be a useful tool BUT it is not good for the 'tricky' groin areas, which is basically the only reason that I bought the thing. The advertising claims, or would lead you to believe, that it is designed specifically for those areas when in truth a Bick razor is much less time consuming and much more efficient, and probably ~gasp~ less hazerdous as the Bodygroom will pinch you (note, not cut ... just pinch and scare the bejeezes out of you) if the skin is not held taught. Additionally, the trimming function of the Bodygroom is virtually useless ... it will take you 5-10 passes with this thing to effectively trim an area, and you have to go SLOOOOOOWWWWWWW with it during those passes. Although I will say that the ability to push or pull is nice with the trimmer, and that the rounded gaurds for the trimmer are ergonomically nice for some of the harder to reach areas. Some advise for potential users ... I have found that with either trimming and especially shaving that the thing works best in the shower when you are lathered up with soap (which the manual says you can do)to let the thing slide. Also a plus is that it doesn't give as much irritation as a manual razor, which is a definately a plus, because I hate getting shaving bumps. Overall, I would only recommend it if you aren't to hairy downstairs and don't really have to trim any of the tricky areas.

I'm of the larger sized men, and my arms aren't as flexible as I'd like them to be. I had a little trouble getting to some hard to reach spots on my back. After about 20 minutes of fumbling and stretching I got it working pretty good.

If not, the plastic and metals edges around the blades will scratch the daylights out of you, just like the old electric razors my dad used 50 years ago. Very honestly, my very trusty Norelco razor with the trimmer on the side does just as good a job and doesn't scratch nearly as much!

  515. I purchased this shaver about one year ago. I wanted something that could help shave and trim all of those hard to reach areas on the male body. Here's what I found with this Philips personal male shaver. (Please note that I do not use it every day, maybe one time per week). The instrument is small and easy to manage. It seems to hold a charge well. It also works in the shower, but trying to snip and shave wet hair is not easy (usually it won't work). It is best to do this while hair is dry. Additionally, if you are using this machine to trim hair on your back, forget it, it is very hard to manage such a maneuver due to the shape and size of the device. The bad new is in the construction of the instrument. If you apply to much pressure, the head or screen collapses on to itself. At several points I had to pull the head apart, and rebuild the blade section using tweezers. It was annoying and difficult. I still don't know how long this repair will last. This shave head of the machine is poorly built. If you plan on using this shaver often, don't buy it. I use a regular Conair (pulg-in) shaver most of the time, its big but it always works. UPDATE: MAY 2009- It finally broke, the rubber on-off switch got stuck on on. Please, keep away from this shaver, it is not made very well.

  522. I bought this to replace my not so nice remington trimmer. I think this is a good shaver for trimming body hair. The guards work just fine for measured trimming despite other complaints. This trimmer doesn't pinch as bad as other shavers I've used, so I'm also not too disappointed with it. In fact, when trimming hair where there is sensitive skin, I find there is much less irritation than with a razor and other trimmers. My HUGE complaint is the way the guards snap on.   571. I've had two of these, both of them \\"died\\" of the same cause.<br /><br />The construction for the power button relies on a little sealed container and a plastic spike pressing on the button.<br /><br />If air escapes the sealed container, the plastic spike is no longer in contact with the button. You then have to open the whole unit up to let some air back into the sealed container. Of course, doing this opening you risk breaking bits and pieces. It's not impossible, but definitely a design flaw.<br /><br />I first got one of these in 2006. A second in 2009. Both have \\"failed\\" in the same way.<br /><br />I do not recommend this model.
  572. This really is a great groomer. It's easy and comfortable to use. The trick is to move the groomer slowly over the areas to be trimmed. If you groom too fast, you won't get a close shave. Also, since body hair grows in different directions, you may have to manuver the groomer in different directions to achieve the optimal trim. I found that you get a pretty close shave (similar to using an electric razor on your face) but it's not the same as using a safety razor. It's also very comfortable - very little skin irritation and no knicks, etc. Also, I haven't had problems with much itching or ingrown hairs. As the instructions say, practice with the #3 attachment so you get used to how the groomer works. The attachments do work, however it depends on the length of the hair that's being trimmed. The #3 doesn't take much hair off, unless it's longer hair. I highly recommend this product and yes it works well in the groin and backside, although you may need someone to groom you back there unless you're good with a mirror.
  573. This shaver is effective and reasonably easy to use, it definitely helps you handle the grooming need it is intended for. I have used it several times and am glad I bought it. Not once have I had a nick or cut. I consider it a very good value for the money I paid.
  574. Not a big fan of hair on any part of my body other than my head. And as a brother with kinky hair all over, using razors is not a pleasant option for removing unwanted hair. This product works great for me. I can shave or trim until my hearts content in a fraction of the time it took using razors. The motor is powerful enough and the blades are sharp enough to remove the hair in 2 sweeps the most. What used to take 10-15 mins in the shower now takes 5 mins the most. I will certainly recommend this product especially for people of color with curly hair like me.

Thanks Phillips Norelco Bodygroom Shaver!!!!<br /><br />The final episode in this rather wild-but-true story occurred when I met one of my best friends--who also happens to be AC DC, proving that many Sunnis like me are actually very tolerant of those afflicted with g*yness--for espressos at Starbucks. He edified me about the reasons that shaving one's body hair completely off was totally acceptable. Before he put it in context, I couldn't see the liberal light, but after my friend of g*yness explained it, it all made sense.<br /><br />After this talk, I'm now a 100% believer in shaving off ALL of my ugly, anti-feminine body hair--and I recommend EVERY MAN to buy this--due to the following reasons:<br /><br />1) Body hair is unclean and raises infection risks<br />2) I may actually be mistaken for *gasp* a man instead of a woman<br />3) It's so passe to actually have the audacity as a man to look like a man in these progressive times we live insense.   578. So, after reading the mixed reviews on here, I decided all the people cutting themselves with this gadget must have been improperly using it and that it would make a great addition to my grooming routine......... I'm here to tell you that if you are interested in SHAVING (not trimming) anything \\"downtown\\", you are in for a very painful experience. The trimming functions work awesomely, great for anywhere below the neck and especially below the waist. HOWEVER, once I tried straight shaving, I was almost brought to tears. This thing pulled, tugged and CUT skin in ways I'd rather not like to relive. I made sure to read the entire instruction pamphlet and followed it perfectly...to no avail. So, if you are looking to trim-up (or prep for shaving) this makes things VERY easy and works just as it should...but if you plan on shaving anything with it, you might be in for a very painful experience. Honestly, you're better off with a good ol' fashioned gilette. I can only guess that the mixed reviews on here are a result of different skin/hair types. It wold only be fair to say that this might work beautifully for you, but my experiences were otherwise.

With my Braun shaver, I have the option to pop up and engage a side trimmer, if needed. It would have been nice if there was some way to disengage the side trimmers on this Philips Norelco shaver to avoid those nasty nicks and cuts, especially in tight, sensitive areas. As far as the actual shave itself, I found it to be not really any comparably closer than my cheap Braun, everyday facial shaver. I'd say it takes just a few minutes to give a quick trim.

  624. I recently purchased the Philips Norelco Bodygroomer and have found it very easy and quick to use. It's simple to assemble and to take apart after using it. You can pick the best attachment to determine hair length for trimming; or use the shaver directly for a close shave with minimal nicks. I've used it as a dry razor, although the instructions note that it can also be used while in the shower. It's not for precision cuts and is not made for use above the neck, as mentioned in the product description. Cleanup is also very fast since the screen easily detaches and can be rinsed in the sink. However, the trimmings land on the floor or counter top, which therefore leads to additional cleanup after shaving. Overall, this is a nice body shaver for guys looking to shave below the neck.
  625. This body groomer does a fantastic job. I don't think there is anything I haven't shaved with this groomer. This is a definate must have for those who want a smooth finish.

Most are positive, but there are some negatives, which make you wonder? I have to say either the negatives didn't use this shaver properly or they're in competition with it. Keep your private parts trimmed low with the adjustment attachments first before trying to take down to skin. I used it dry, but will try it with shaving cream at some point too. Dry just seems to make more sense so you can see where you're shaving to get a nice edge on what you leave on.
  628. This product has lived up to all my demands for it. I use it mainly for trimming purposes and and in that capacity it works admirably. The first trimming session on my chest took a little longer than I might have liked but I do have a fairly hairy chest. Now that I am trimming the shorter hair, the shaver accomplishes the task pretty quickly. The only place I have shaved bald with the shaver is the slight hair on my shoulders and the somewhat thicker hair on the small of my back, which is the extent of my back hair (so far anyway). These tasks were achieved very quickly and the results were a pain-free, smooth shave. The design of the shaver is outstanding. The contour of the it fits well into my hand and the guards can be attached to use the upper or lower blades. The guards themselves are easy to snap on but are a bit harder to snap off, which isn't a big deal. My only regret in regards to the design is that a guard one size bigger wasn't included. The biggest guard, labeled '3', still cuts the hair pretty short, which makes the results more drastic than one might have desired. The charging stand has a small profile and will not add significantly to the clutter of one's counter top. I have experienced no problems with the battery life (and the shaver even came with a decent pre-charge--though not full--which is rare for most electronics). This is my first body grooming device and it has been up to every task I have placed before it. Highly Recommended.
  629. I didnt even expect it to be this good. Simple, easy to use... Just perfect!!!
  630. Before I purchased this item, I read the mostly favorable reviews and got pretty excited, but for around $35.00 I was cautiously optimistic. After charging the unit I tried it out for the first time, and found it took some time to get used to, for two reasons. 1. Getting the angle right so it trims well is tricky 2. Getting comfortable using a device that looks like this around your private areas is unsettling initially, but I've used it 3 times now and haven't had a nick or cut yet. This product does what its name implies, it \\"grooms\\" you, it doesn't shave you. What I mean by this is, you will get a much closer shave by using a manual (facial) razor and shaving cream/gel. It does feel sturdy, however the head can be a little large for getting certain areas. All in all a nice unit, but don't expect a straight-edge shave with it.

  634. I used this product for over a year, so am well familiar with its ins and outs. On the good end, it shaves well and cleanly without the attachments. The precision blade works well for general shaping and the foil is effective for cleaning up. On the bad end, the attachments don't work well. Hair collects in them easily and prevents further effective shaving. The hair is hard to remove without taking off the attachment. Also, note how the blades are positioned on both sides of the foil; it makes it very hard to use the foil on sensitive regions without nicking oneself with the blades. Finally, I tried using this once and only once in the shower. The razor stopped working the next day. RIP. For shaving one's own back hair, it's too hard to reach with this; try the Mangroomer (as silly as the name may be, it's a good product)! For other shaving, I've replaced this with a Wahl 9953 and hope for better results.
  635. I must admit I purchased this item for what it does.. trims and shaves in areas where a regular razor will leave burn or cuts and an electric razor is just not designed to trim or shave. Leaving it out where my wife could find it was the best thing that could have happened...
  636. I loved this thing until the metal grill came off. Took about two months of light use. Won't buy again. EDIT: I figured out that you can buy replacement heads for this thing (after throwing the the whole thing away, my bad). So I love this thing and it is easy to maintain. :)

  645. this product is awful for use as a trimmer, the included blue clip on height regulators easily pop off when you apply pressure to them while shaving hard to reach places or places where the hair is oriented in different directions. In addition the blue attachments have sharp edges that tend to snag skin when used in tight spaces. When using without the attachments the n aked shaver itself requires mutliple passes over the same are to get hair level down to height neededfor the foil shaver to \\"shave\\" the remaining stuble away. Even that shave process requires numerous passes regardless of whether you use it in the shower with running water or dry. If you plan to use it to reduce body hair length with their the naked shaver or with the blue clip on attachments, forget about it! You essentially would have to pull the hairs taught with tweezers and them pass the machine over the taught hair. In my experience the only thing this machine is reasonble good at is wet shaving of areas where you have already gotten the hair down to a reasonable length, I would say no longer than 1, with either another set of trimmers or scissors. As a shaver, with super short hair and fuzz, it works pretty well in the shower under running water and is not irritating at all. It's also noteworthy to mention that the foil is extremely delicate and intolerant of any drops, such as might happen often with a wet body trimmer in the shower whilst reaching around for hard to get at spots. But for trimming hair, I would not recommend this product at all.

  648. The basic shaver does what it says, however, the trimming guards fall off constantly due to poor design it seems. I had to constantly keep my finger pressed over the back of the plastic to prevent it falling on the ground. Even then, I would have to reattach multiple times each use. Additionally, I finally ended up smashing the hell out of the thing in a fit of annoyance when battery flaws rendered the damn thing too annoying to use. Let me explain: 1) the manual tells you not to leave it on the charger constantly and only charge it up until the red light on the adapter turns off. This is an annoying oversight; I mean should I really have to schedule my week to know when I want a charged appliance? Really? 2) the charge capacity is erratic. Sometimes I would pull it off the charger and have nothing, only to set it back in and see that it had no juice. 3) power control is occasionally non-functional. There were numerous incidents where the thing would turn on, but not off until I put it back in the charger or the battery ran down. Other times it would not turn on until a once-in quickly in the charger stand to reset it (apparently). So, you may ask: why didn't I return it? Well, I like what it did when it worked, and there's not many alternatives, so I stuck it out, but it was never an enjoyable product, and it needs a major redesign. I gave it two stars, because it is not an abomination that cuts you or is otherwise dangerous, but it is not well conceived. If Philips makes a new version I will check it out in the store to see if these issues are resolved and give it another go.

If you've ever used a hair buzzer on your body you know that they can leave raised red lines on you for hours. This just wont happen with the bodygroom.<br /><br />Cons:<br />- It's a little under powered and occasionally the blade will get caught and pop out of the housing.<br />- I never thought of this as a hair buzzer (for my head), so the snap on attachments are fairly useless. It's quick...private...and I put it on the charger once a week for overnight...just like my electric toothbrush!!!   677. I had tried a couple of other products for the \\"franks and beans,\\" but none of them worked all that well. The creams and cheap shavers I tried were inconsistent and the beard trimmer I have was too harsh. The trimmer's teeth were too big and resulted in lots of nicks and cuts. That ain't gonna work! So I was skeptical about this product even after reading the reviews. But I've got to say that this thing is awesome! <br /> <br />Performance: Great performance wet or dry! The teeth on the clipper are much smaller than conventional clippers, so as long as you pull wrinkly areas taut, you're all good. You get a good shave dry, but I've found that some soap and water in the shower work best for me. And if you are new to shaving down there, it may take a few passes to get totally smooth results so be patient. Again, that's just me. Everyone's different. <br /> <br />Construction: As with anything, you get what you pay for. It's much better that a cheap ten dollar shaver, but It's not as well put together as the $90 Braun shaver I use on my face. All in all, it's good construction for the money. <br /> <br />Accessories: The only bad thing I can say about the Bodygroom (and the only reason I'm giving 4 stars instead of five) is that the attachments are a little disappointing. First off, I found the instructions a little unclear as to how they go on and off, but after I figured it out, there were no further problems. Second, I don't see much of a difference in length between the combs, and it would be nice if there were a travel case or at least an accessory case. However, I got this for a smooth shave, not for subtle trims so for me the disappointment in the accessories is not a big issue. <br /> <br />All in all, this is a wonderful tool! I couldn't live without it and have it proudly displayed on the counter. I would recommend this to anyone who is looking for smooth, silky goodness on all your fun parts. <br />
  678. The trimmer works very well. It is smoother and more powerful than I actually expected. I found the attachment combs to be quite useful too, although it takes a few minutes to get the hang of how to use them most effectively. They are a little flimsy, so be careful when pulling them off. Cleaning the device is very easy, and is really just another example of the simplicity of the trimmer.The battery and recharging time needs particular attention though, and can be quite an inconvenience, which is pretty much the only reason this doesn't get 5 stars. If they release a slightly more expensive updated version with a battery that doesn't overcharge/overheat and die out, then I'll be upgrading to that. Overall, a very nifty trimmer.

  691. This trimmer does work well for, as they say, anything below the neck. *Almost*. You'll definitely need to be very careful trimming your (ahem) more sensitive areas. While its true that the shaving blades are completely protected from nicking your skin, the vibrating trimmers pointing straight out on either side of the foil can make this shaver even more dangerous than a normal one. I think a good solution would have to involve getting those trimmers out of harm's way, or maybe only putting a trimmer on one side of the foil, not both. <br /> <br />Aside from being primed for grabbing and cutting through some very sensitive skin, the trimmers on both sides also mean no matter where you want to shave with the foil, you're leading with a trimmer. This limits what you can and can't do. If you'd like to, for instance, shave bare all the way to the edge of your naughty bits, the trimmer's position means you'll be forced to trim the hair on part of your thigh as well. <br /> <br />Good idea for a product, but clearly not as well-tested as it could have been. 3 stars for the quality construction and its ability for most areas, -2 for the dangerous design in the most important spots.

  696. It tends to work better dry but the wet feature is great as well. It is easy to clean, and does a great job in those tough hard to reach areas. Before this I used a razor to shave in the \\"downstairs\\" region but I haven't looked back since.
  697. Let's start with this fact: the Philips Norelco BG2020 Bodygroom works great right out of the box. Just charge it up, slap on your preferred guard size, and start grooming. It gets to the hard to reach areas and, with some stretching, can even get the center of your back! It's easy to use and easy to clean. No problems. Best trimmer of its kind. The issue comes when you've had the groomer for six months or more. If you have to change guards often (as in, you want to use #1 for \\"the boys\\", but #2 for the rest of your body, and #3 for calves and forearms). The guards snap onto the groomer using a notch-and-nub system that, for a time, works great. But over time, after snapping on and off, these notches wear out. Eventually any amount of pressure on the tip of the guards will result in your guard popping off and BUZZ you get a big bald spot on your body. It's particularly annoying to be in the middle of a very visible area (like your chest) and have the guard pop off. The reward is a large spot that looks totally ridiculous. This is a design flaw that should be remedied with any future models. The guards need to be more secure... perhaps a slot on the sides upon which you slide the guards onto the unit? Additionally, the rechargeable battery eventually loses steam after a few months of use. After a year of use, I am lucky to get 10 minutes of charge out of it. That makes grooming particularly inconvenient. I have to do it in stages. Chest one day, back another, and so on. It would be nice if a) you could buy new guards separately from the unit (in the even that you lose them or they wear down as described above) and b) if you could buy a new battery for the groomer. Overall, I will buy another Bodygroom Shaver, but I do it begrudgingly with the knowledge that I will run into these issues again a year from now.
  698. Bought this for my boyfriend. I thought it would be good since he could use it in the shower. Apparenlty its not that great. He only used it once and then ended up buying something else.
  699. Very close shave. No nicks or cuts, EVER. Works beautifully in the shower. Only problem I had was that the blue plastic attachments were hard to remove.. I always thought they were going to snap and break (and I followed the directions) but I don't use them anyway, Overall, an amazing product. Charges well too.
  700. This was kind of a bummer. I was really anticipating getting this, but was really let down. I knock down my chest hair usually every couple of months. But this could not manage to trim much. Performs poorly in comparison to the standard beard trimmer. Had to keep running over the same spots repeatedly to get any results. Returned this after the first use.
  701. I was looking through the stuff on Amazon the other day and I came across this Norelco shaver thing. Now I'm not real big on beauty products or nothing but I thought heck, I could use this thing for my regular shaver and maybe my sideburns and other stuff too. So I bought one and it came real quick all packed up in a nice blue box with a whole bunch of extra doodads included(which I promptly threw away.) It was a Saturday and my girlfriend Lisa had just left with her friends to go to the mall. There I was all alone with nothing to do, so I thought what the heck, let's give `er a spin.<br /><br />So I cut my beard and trimmed my moustache and sideburns and ear hair, but I was still feeling like I need more of a test drive so I took off my shirt and started in on my arms and chest hair, when that was all smooth, I dropped trou and started in on my leg hair, I shaved my hands and feet and eventually there wasn't anything left but the nether regions. Now they have all sorts of advice about this area on the Norelco website and at first I was thinking like `no way dude' but you know how it is when you get something new---you just gotta use it! So I figure `let's go for the full monty.'<br /><br />So I started cutting the grass on my frank and beans when the darn thing starts malfunctioning or something and before you know it, it's just yankin out the hair by the roots and I'm jumping around hollering like a banshee trying to get it off my nards. Well, I finally hit the kill button on it or something cause it just sputtered a few times and went dead. What a nightmare!<br /><br />Anyway, I'm standing there naked as a jaybird with this thing hanging off my boys and feeling a good deal of buyer's remorse when suddenly Lisa (I didn't hear her return) came running into the bedroom with her girlfriend Jody all excited about something they just bought at the mall when they both come to a screeching halt (I swear their tennies left skid marks on the hardwood floor) and let out a pair of screams like I never heard before or since. Jody bolted and I don't think she stopped running till she got all the way home. Lisa just started backing up real slow like she didn't want to make any sudden moves (like you do with crazy people.)<br /><br />My dog Tobie just sat there lookin at me with those big dachshund eyes and sort of a weird grin on his chops like I was some kind of freak or something and then he just dropped a rose (farted) and left the room to go watch some TV or nose around his food bowl or something.<br /><br />I figured there was only one way out of this whole mess and so I -yup, you guessed right- fired the thing back up gave a yank off the jewels and started shaving all the hair off my head and told Lisa that I'd caught a case of fleas from Tobie and that was why I had shaved very last nook and cranny. I don't know if she believed me or not and she slept on the couch last night but that's my story and I'm sticking to it.<br /><br />Of course I had to shave Tobie right down to the nubs too (serves him right, the little turncoat) and now he runs and hides behind the couch every time he hears me shaving in the morning but I figure he'll be back to normal once the smell of flea powder goes away.<br /><br />Jody's old man Billy rang me up and gave me a rash of crap for being a closet weirdo and threatened to tell all the neighbors, but I'm still gonna have to go with 5 stars for the product since it worked exactly like promised (except for that malfunction) and maybe then some...besides, I don't think the three stooges have ever looked so clean cut.<br /><br />Steve and Tobie from Belchertown, MAnever heard before or since. Jody bolted and I don't think she stopped running till she got all the way home. Lisa just started backing up real slow like she didn't want to make any sudden moves (like you do with crazy people.) My dog Tobie just sat there lookin at me with those big dachshund eyes and sort of a weird grin on his chops like I was some kind of freak or something and then he just dropped a rose (farted) and left the room to go watch some TV or nose around his food bowl or something. I figured there was only one way out of this whole mess and so I -yup, you guessed right- fired the thing back up gave a yank off the jewels and started shaving all the hair off my head and told Lisa that I'd caught a case of fleas from Tobie and that was why I had shaved very last nook and cranny. I don't know if she believed me or not and she slept on the couch last night but that's my story and I'm sticking to it. Of course I had to shave Tobie right down to the nubs too (serves him right, the little turncoat) and now he runs and hides behind the couch every time he hears me shaving in the morning but I figure he'll be back to normal once the smell of flea powder goes away. Jody's old man Billy rang me up and gave me a rash of crap for being a closet weirdo and threatened to tell all the neighbors, but I'm still gonna have to go with 5 stars for the product since it worked exactly like promised (except for that malfunction) and maybe then some...besides, I don't think the three stooges have ever looked so clean cut. You get three trimming kits based on length, so you can adjust based on your needs. I have since removed the comb completely and gone with the smooth look. Caution here for the guys, GO SLOWLY! Patience is a virtue! And less painful.

  725. This thing works great as everyone else has pointed out, but the main problems with it are: 1. The battery. Do NOT, and I repeat, DO NOT leave this device consistently charging. In a matter of months the internal battery will be ruined and the charge will only last 15 minutes tops. This isn't really the fault of Norelco, but traditionally, I have left my electric razors plugged in and never had a problem. 2. The on/off button sometimes sticks. It's not the greatest design in the world, but if yours should get stuck, apparently Norelco will replace it if its still under warranty. If it's not, the shaver comes apart pretty easily and it's a simple repair. I just bought a second bodygroom, because on my first one, i killed the battery (a few minutes then dies) and it's stuck in the on position (even after the fix, i believe the constant charging may have done this as well). So don't leave it plugged in and you'll be fine!

Norelco either needs to include replacement foils or make it easier to buy them. Wouldn't mind paying $5 with free shipping, but $24? Of course, Norelco wins, b/c I tossed the whole thing and bought a new device. The latest version works without the foil on the trimmer, so it should last longer.

You find yourself grooming past the areas you thought you'd groom. Like the shins. Why did I trim my shin hair? Probably because I still had 46 of those 50 body grooming minutes left. It's also easy to trim some areas to bit closer than intended. I thought it would itch more as hair grew back, but so far everything is OK.

However, the customer service agent said that he would send me a COMPLETE REPLACEMENT kit free of charge--all I had to do was send back my current unit when the new one arrives in the self addressed package.   753. Like many of the other reviewers of the BG2020 I am shocked at how many positive reviews this little trimmer has received.<br /><br />I've been using a standard corded Wahl trimmer off and on for a number of years to keep certain areas of body hair in check without hassle. When I saw this Philips-Norelco body hair trimmer as the deal of the day here at Amazon I jumped at the opportunity. For one thing thinking that this trimmer was specifically designed for more coarse body hair I figured it would make grooming easier. Secondly the unit is cordless which is always easier.<br /><br />So a few days after my trimmer arrived I stepped into the shower planning on making a quick trim before heading out with some friends. The first thing I notice is that this trimmer feels cheap. Everything from the trimmer to the attachment heads is made from cheap plastic. The trimmer doesn't feel like it has the weight to cut through hair and once I started trimming my suspicions were spot-on accurate. The BG2020 is more of a hair-puller than trimmer.<br /><br />I ended up having to repeatedly pass the BG2020 over certain areas which inevitably leads to irritation. I thought maybe it works better with shower turned on and wet. Wrong again.<br /><br />So I ended up chucking this thing in a bathroom drawer and I honestly don't plan on ever using it again. What a waste of $30. If you have anything more than peach fuzz I would recommend staying away!

I was very cautious at first because nobody likes getting nicked or cut down there but after my second use I decided to be a bit more cavalier and still didn't get nicked.   761. I recently purchased the BG2020 Body Groomer after reading the many positive reviews here, but I felt it was not a quality product. I'm having a hard time figuring out why there are so many positive reviews. First of all, it takes a long time to charge and you have to be careful not to overcharge it. That means that you cannot leave it in the base plugged in. It does not have the lithium batteries so it takes much longer to charge, doesn't hold a charge very long, and the batteries have a memory. I hate rechargeable batteries with a memory because they are not going to last very long. You have to let it run down all the way before you charge it again and as the batteries get weaker, the more it pulls on hair (ouch!). It did a lousy job trimming and pulled a lot. You really have to work at it to get it to cut anything and it doesn't trim close enough. The trimmer just seems too underpowered to do a decent job. I did appreciate that Phillips has a 45 day return policy (it says 60 day on the Amazon page, but it was only 45 for mine) so I sent it in for a refund. That was only a few weeks ago, so I haven't gotten the refund yet. Update: Norelco customer service was very helpful and refunded my money with not problems.
  762. The Body Groomer is the biggest piece of CRAP I have ever used. What happened to the quality of a Norelco razor? In less than 3 weeks the blades wore through the foil on the razor causing me razor burns. Customer service would not help me. I would NOT recommend this razor to anyone!!!!
  763. This is a great product! I dont have much experience with body trimming but this product gets the job done. It works great in showers and the battery life is long, however it is limited on trimming settings, only 3 heads. I wanted to trim legs half a centimeter but with this trimmer I am forced to trim all hair off and wait until hair grows preferred length. Also, you have to buy foil replacement, it breaks easy. And yes it WILL break! Its impossible not to drop this thing in the shower, its durable however the foil breaks easy and if you dont replace it then the result is little cuts on the body similar to shaving your face. Dont use this on your face, its strictly a body trimmer. Note: Maybe only 1 in 1000 customers post a review of a product or service they use. Why post a review? What is in it for reviewer 1,385? By voicing your opinion you may help other customers who think similar to you find or avoid a product. Both positive and negative reviews can help people decide if a product might be for them, especially if they don't associate themselves with a positive or negative reviewer. I write reviews because I have saved a lot of time and money by reading other people's reviews. Do a civic duty and help other customers; write a review.
  764. LOL The best I can do is agree with all the positive feedback on this honey of a shaver!! I've been using it for several months now and have not one complaint. \\"None\\" of my skin has ever been irritated, and I get into some sensitive areas... Battery life is nothing short of amazing! I can't begin to guess at how many shaves I get on a full charge. If you prefer bare skin over fur, this is your tool!! One caveat is that the trimmer blades on the outside WILL bite you if you're not careful in certain areas(like in the crotch!)...as mentioned by others. Overall GREAT shaver!!! P.S. The model number is very appropriate since the designer had \\"2020\\" vision for a great product!
  765. I've owned two of these. Both of them cut very well and would, easily,be worthy of 5 stars were it not for the fact that both died within an 18 month period. I just had the second one die, now. The button to turn the device on and off failed on both units and, quite obviously, rendered the device useless. With the second unit, I had to pry it open and cut a power cable just to get it to shut off. Even pressing the button on the circuit board, itself, didn't work. I needed a replacement and, based on my experiences with the Bodygroom line, I went with a Remington. Hopefully, the Remington can combine the very close shave of the Bodygroom with some sort of longevity.

The charging base works very well. The razor holds a charge for many days.

  789. I've been through two of these so far. First one lasted about 13 months, then stopped taking a charge (it was the shaver, not the charger). Second one lasted 6 months and the button became stuck and you could not turn if off or recharge it, so it sat in the bathroom sink bouncing around for 8 hours until the juice ran out. They say they have a 2 year warranty but it's not worth the postage to send the stupid thing back. When it works, it gives a very effective and painless groom everywhere, really liked the ease of using and the result from it. Blades seem to last about 7 months before they need to be changed, using it once a week.
  790. When I initially received this item, it worked reasonably well. If you don't use it every day, you may need it to work for >10 minutes while you carefully shave and trim your body.   791. I bought this product from a local walmart about a year ago. I figured it was the perfect thing to use for all the unwanted hair. I have used it for chest, arms, abs and gentleman's region. The trimmers worked quite well in cutting the long hairs (though i am not a particularly hairy guy) and the foil shaver did its job as well. However, it is very wide which i suppose is nice for large flat areas such as the chest and abs but for the arms and groin, takes much more focus to get the desired result. Particularly in the groin area. Here, you have to be weary of the double sided garden hedge trimmer that cuts sensitive sins almost as well as it does hair. I also found it to not glide over the skin to effectively use the foil shaver. It says you can use it in the shower as well which i tried with less than desirable results. Also, unless you clean it regularly and meticulously, a hair dust builds up in the foil shaver and begins to distribute it all over whatever you are shaving over (for me, it was my sink and counter top). though i suppose all this issues can be resolved with some practice and regular maintenance. but my problem came right about when the warrantee ended. The charging base no longer works leaving me a permanently dead shaver. Maybe this was just a faulty base specific to me but disappointing none the less.

  796. 1-yr follow up:<br /><br />I love this groomer, the replacement blade is cheap. I use Norelco's SensoTouch 3D technology for shaving, but still finish off my face with this.<br /><br />Quick, painless, and smooth wet or dry groomer. I recommend the combination of any inexpensive pharmacy-store Norelco shaver and the BG2020 for a close facial shave too. The design and features of the top-of-the-line Norelco shavers are enticing, but $300+ price tags aren't. With this little gizmo, you can better use that money for a cheap weekend stacation package or whatever...<br /><br />My only complaints are 1) the bulky charge base. I would prefer the option of direct cord-groomer charge without base. Other Norelco shavers allow for either connection. 2) The green charge light never goes off... Don't know if this is a common defect or if it's just mine that's broken. At first, I thought, \\"gee, damn thing sure does take a long time to charge.\\" Now, the light stays on for as long as two days between use. So, in effect, the charge indicator indicates nothing.

The only time I am at home for that long is when I am sleeping. The fact that the batteries lifespan is reduced from overcharging does not help this flaw. Second, all the attachments trap the hair in them and clog up. This means in order to shave your body you have to constantly push out the trapped hair. All in all, I would like to see a higher quality product for more money. As it is you're better off buying a nice Wahl beard trimmer.

I required frequent cleaning of the most minute amount of hair in order to work at even a minimal level. I recommend that you buy something more powerful and a better design.
  868. i used it for the first time. it does pretty well, its not great like a razor but it does the job, also you can use it with water, or in the shower.
  869. After a year of a good grooming, the unit's switch suddenly got stuck in the \\"on\\" position. Middle of the night, total silence in the house.. Except for what sounded like a huge vibrator. Had to shove it under a pillow and wait till the batteries died. Arrrgh.<br /><br />Now, how do you fix that? Pretty simple. The switch is getting stuck because of the vacuum developing inside of the watertight container. The unit is getting hot in the shower, pressure inside increases, and it (somehow) releases that pressure. Eventually, you are getting enough vacuum to suck the membrane that covers the switch almost all the way in. All you have to do to fix that is let some air in.<br /><br />First, make sure the unit is dry in and out. Use a compressed air can to blow water drops out of hard to reach places if you have to. You don't want to let any water get inside! Now, remove the head. Just pull it out.<br /><br />Next, using a flathead screwdriver or utility knife, pull out those silvery colored side moldings. The case will open like a clamshell. You will find a fairly small watertight container with all of the electrical components inside. Carefully pull out any of the latches that are used to keep it closed. Pull two latches if that wasn't enough; your on/off switch membrane will immediately \\"pop\\" back into shape.<br /><br />Reseal the unit back like it was before. Works like new!
  870. I have thick hair. The blades easily clog in the shower and I spend more time cleaning it than I do trimming. It does what it claims. I would like more efficient blades and maybe a larger trimming head. I like how it has blades on both sides of the head. The part in the middle, like an electric razor head, trims below the skin surface. On wet skin, it gave me a bit of razor burn, even with soap applied. All in all, it works well and does what it claims to do. I'm pleased.
  871. My first complaint about this shaver is that it does not cut well if the body hair lies down on the body. It takes several passes from different directions to do an acceptable job. The second complaint is that if the body hair has any length at all, it is necessary to frequently stop to clear the hair out of the cutting area. Otherwise it will not cut. Blowing on it sometimes works but usually I have to remove the guide and flick it out with a toothpick of something comparable. My third complaint is that the battery is kaput after two years of use and it is probably not cost effective to have it replaced. I am generous in giving it a three star rating.
  872. This simple little razor is the one tool the guys need to do all the trimming that needs to be done. Even the delicate areas are cleaned up with no pinching, pulling, burning or hassle. One tool to get it all done
  873. This is a good product and has amazing battery life. My body hair grows at a pretty fast rate and I guess I am a bit vein. Instead of looking like the missing link, I prefer to limit my body hair. I can usually do my arms, legs and chest inside of 15 minutes.<br /><br />The only drawbacks are that hair can jam up in the shaver area and that it is just a bit bulky. I am sure that the bulk is attributed to the battery so that is acceptable.<br /><br />BillH
  874. I'm a fairly hairy dude and this just made things annoying. The whole &#34;waterproof&#34; gimmick? It couldn't cut through anything with the water running and was only mildly successful when I was completely dry.

  879. I bought one of these Body Groomers about 5 years ago, and I've been using it every Thursday since then. It takes a little bit to get used to the trimming settings, but believe you me, they're worth it. I'm a huge fan of \\"man-scaping\\" and trim everything except for the twig n berries, which get shaved. When doing some heavy mowing, you do need to periodically brush off hair from the razor, which is no major inconvenience. As far as nicking yourself goes, as long as you stretch your skin out and trim in a smooth, controlled manner, you'll be fine. The only time I've nicked myself was when i was blindly shaving a veryyy hard to reach place. The cut is always good, no razor burn or irritation for me. The length of the charge is good, but make sure it doesn't die halfway through your work of art, otherwise you'll have to risk a pretty embarassing / funny encounter. Another thing, the Philips Norelco Bodygroom Shaver is similar to a car, in the sense that you really really don't want to operate either machinery after you've had any alcohol to drink... and I'll leave it at that. Overall, its a fantastic item that I've had for a very long time, and don't plan on replacing anytime soon.

This allows the outer edge to go to battle first, and then allow the tiny blades (centered) to clean it up.   926. I have been using this on a regular basis for over a year. I really like this device as it lasts and it is very rare that you make yourself bleed (anywhere) when you use it properly. You can shave basically all parts of your body with it but there are several points I should make that will make this device work better. Make sure you are careful before you start shaving in the more uncomfortable places and if you are not sure if you will nick yourself because you are at a bad angle on in a sensitive area readjust and try again. Also, you really should use it on a regular basis if you are shaving and not trimming because it does not work as well on a jungle and the more managable a job you give it the better it does. Additionally, you really should invest in replacement cartridges because they do not last forever and they are reasonably inexpensive on here especialy with subscribe and save. For me, I usually replace the razor every 6 months. There are one major issues with the device which is why it does not get 5 stars from me, no battery indicator. Because of the type of battery used, it is best to only charge the battery after it is completely empty. The problem is you never know for sure how much juice is left. Therefore, if you are grooming for a special occasion, you always have to be aware of this. A simple battery indicator would make this device infinitely more useful. In any event, I do recommend this body groomer!

  932. I just used the trimmer for the first time this morning, and I'm very satisfied with the results. I find that the positive reviews thus far have been on the mark. To optimize your experience, I suggest reading thru the included instructions. The trimmer requires an initial eight hour charge. Also, don't leave the trimmer continously charging. Doing so will drastically reduce the life of the battery. Here's a direct quote from the instructions: \\"Do not use the Groomer to shave or trim facial or scalp hair. The Groomer should only be used on skin below the neckline.\\" That should address some of the negative reviews. As for myself, I really liked that you could either push or pull the trimmer to get better access to some areas. (Note if you are using the blue plastic guides, you'll have to flip them around to trim in the opposite direction.) Depending on how much hair you have, the blue guides will clog especially if this is the first time you trimmed a particular area. This is not unexpected and a quick poof of air on the trimmer resolves the problem. I suspect this will be less of an issue when you get the hair down to size and are simply maintaining the length. Go slow! It's easy to want to rush especially when you are getting near the end. Take your time and your patience will be rewarded. If you have a lot of hair, it might take more than one initial session to get the results you want. Personally, I'm happy with the purchase and the price. I would definitely recommend this product to others.
  933. Having been spoiled by the effectiveness and convenience of my Braun for face shaving, I didn't have the patience to use shaving cream and razors for trimming or removing body hair. I've tried my cheap Wahl beard trimmer, which worked well on thick hair like armpits, and my Braun shaver, which was fine for shoulders, but neither was safe for use in the nether regions. Enter the Bodygroom, which works much better below the waist, and nearly as well above it. A few notes, though: Since the trimmers are much finer than on a beard trimmer, you have to take your time and work more slowly if you're clear-cutting old growth forest, or it will snag and pull hairs. Also, do be careful on areas of loose skin (you know which I mean), since the trimmers can still nick skin if it isn't pulled taught. I haven't tried it yet with shaving cream, but comparing wet to dry, dry seems to work better. Importantly, it comes with a money-back guarantee, so if you try it and don't like it you're not stuck with it.
  934. This is a great idea, but the execution is lacking. As is, you practically have to be a contortionist to use the silly thing. (Or duct-tape it to a broom handle.)
  935. I have found over the last two weeks that this product is adequate for most of my grooming needs. It has three comb sizes and can get fairly close to the skin. Now, for us hairier individuals, some prep work will have to be done on its initial use. This doesn't have the power to cut through a lot of hair. I would recommend you very carefully cut off the longer stuff with some small(yet sharp) scissors. This device is more of a maintainer. If you use it once a week, it should more than get the job done. Cleaning is extremely easy. You can pop off the entire cutting unit and brush out all the necessary areas.<br /><br />I must emphasize on taking your time when grooming yourself. This process should never be rushed (especially the groin area and for those of you with senstive skin). Upon reading some of the negative reviews, i could not help but think that some were expecting this device to make grooming take seconds. Your first grooming session will obviously take the longest, and I recommend you take the time. Like I said above, this device maintains the shorter length of hair you desire.<br /><br />For the price, + accessories and ease of use, you can't go wrong.<br /><br />7/26/12 Update:<br />Battery started to go recently. Wouldn't hold a charge. Still a decent purchase for something that lasted as long as it did. Would NOT buy another however. The Wahl Lithium Ion Trimmer just has to many advantages over this.
