  943. After hearing about this when it was being promoted on the Howard Stern show I decided to pick one up. The shaver itself has a nice comfortable design. However, as noted in other reviews, the guides are awful. They do not do a good job of guiding the hair to the blades, making your trimming look uneven and sloppy. Another problem I have had is when trimming without the guides the blade unit has a tendecy to pop right out of the shaver. Sure it easily snaps back into place, but itis annoying and can easily mess up what you are doing. This product is a great idea, but something really needs to be done about how well it works with the guides, as I don't always want to go down to bare skin.
  944. The worst thing I have ever bought. Does not work at all.
  945. Bought two of these for gifts based on the wet/dry emphasis. Never realized you \\"can't\\" use if for facial hair!!!!!!!!!! How stupid and embarassing!!!!!!!!!!! Please take my purchases back!!!!!!!
  946. My wife and I purchased this item as a Christmas gift for our 20 year old son. He loves it. It's easy to use and except for the fact that the removable blade guides are a bit tough to get off the shaver...it works like a champ. <br /> <br />As the generation of \\"hairless is better\\"...from the \\"other generation\\"..it's a keeper. Reasonably priced and easy to use. A great gift for that teen/twentysomething that has everything! <br />
  947. Excellent product. Let's you trim as much or as little as you want. Works very well on your more sensitive body parts. Even though it works in the shower, I found it to do a much better job if used dry. Easy to clean
  948. I bought this thinking I'd have a good all-around shaver and it certainly wasn't that. It can't do much more than a centimeter's worth of hair length on your head before it starts bunching up and cutting nothing. The plastic guards are a pain to put on and take off, are inconsistent and frequently PULL the hair straight out of your beard.....not pleasant. The hair on my back is rather fine and stays pretty close to the skin and the shaver did little to get it all. <br /> <br />I guess I shouldn't have expected as much as I did but with a name like \\"Bodygroom\\", I would think it would work on more of your body. I can't even imagine how angry I'd be if I had used those crummy, hair pulling guards below the belt.
  949. This razor is not a bad deal, even though its a bit pricey. Its only really good for those \\"tender areas\\", since it would take waaayy too long to shave your entire body with it. However it is by far the most comfortable product I've used. I have had is no irritation even when going over the same area multiple times and it does a good job of getting rid of your hair. It isn't perfect though, so after you use it you still may want to tidy up with a conventional razor if you have a hot date.
  950. Does what it's supposed to do very well. No nicks or razor burn.
  951. I give the Bodygroom a 4/5 rating. It seems there was so much hype for this product, yet it didn't seem to deliver the one-two punch it claimed to be able to throw. That being said, I still think it works very well for what it does. The trick is to go slow, and it cuts much better.
  952. I had my doubts about this device seeing the Philips name on it but knowing that Norelco had something to do with it eased my mind and I thought I'd give in. I have been using a Norelco face trimmer with a flip trim thingy to shave below the neck for years and it has gotten way too annoying. I saw the ad for this product in Men's Health magazine. Those bald kiwis really made me think \\"it can't cut that close without pain?\\" Oh yes, it can. I have used this thing pretty much everywhere below the neck, including my \\"kiwi fruit\\" and it works flawlessly, just don't rush it. Philips/Norelco really hit the nail on the head with this product. I was wondering how long it would take companies to realize that guys like to keep it clean down there too and there weren't many choices and I refuse to wax. I don't like too much hair, but I don't like silky smooth skin either, I am still a guy. If you think trimming down there is feminine, than it's your loss. Warning, if using this on your legs, it does get pretty darn close to a clean shave so be sure you want the hair gone. I have only charged it once, and that was the first time I used it. I've had the product for about 3 weeks and have used it several times within that time frame for about 15 minutes at a time and the battery has yet to need a charge. Cleaning is fairly simple, but the first time it does take some effort to snap that razor foil off. Make sure its snapped on well. Great design, awesome colors (black & blue are my favorite), and lightweight. Easy to pack for a trip, just need to find a bag for it.
  953. This product works OK. That said, I think it is overhyped or perhaps I got a subpar unit. In the past, I had a cheap hair / beard trimmer that did a better job with body hair than this product does. With this unit, it takes several passes over the same area before the hair is trimmed to the length you expect. It looks like the blades just don't \\"bite\\" well or maybe the comb attachments can be designed better - I do not know what the issue is, just that it takes way too long to get things done.
  954. It is a good close shaver that doesn't leave any knicks, (he he) if you know what I mean. I recommend it to anyone who wants to do some MANSCAPING.
  955. This shaver works great. I've even recommended it to other people and they love it too.
  956. [[ASIN:B000EG8HLE Philips Norelco Bodygroom Shaver]] This is a great product. It makes shaving those \\"sensitive\\" areas easier and safer than a razor.   958. Trimmer still catches skin in those 'highly sensitive' areas. I was left with irritated skin that took a day to heal. The shave head does not shave closely AT ALL. I was still left with stubble on my chest and stomach. Up close, there is VERY visible hair that looks like you took a trimmer and shaved. I used this tool once and since have been using my Gillette triple blade razor every other day with a between trim with my Braun Synchro. Both of which produce a much cleaner look with no stubble and less irritation than this product. I am keeping it for trimming other parts.
  959. Norelco Bodygroom shaver works exactly as advertised. I found it easy to use on all mentioned body parts with no irritation. When used as directed, the shaver stays charged for maximum use.
  960. I have been looking for a device to shave everywhere, especially my pubes, my scrotum, my penis, and my anus. I don't like razors: too messey and beside I nick myself a lot. But the Norelco groomer is the best yet with a fine and small cutting head to miminize irritation. I can certainly recommend it.   961. I'm a young guy with excessive body hair problems (back, upper arms, shoulders, etc.) I've used hair trimmers for a long time to deal with the problem, mainly corded hair clippers or cordless sideburn trimmers to get the bulk off, and then using a razor with cream to get smooth. I had heard about Philips BodyGroomer, was amused by the website, and I received one for Xmas. I let it charge for two days, read the instructions, and let the girlfriend have a go with it on my back. Now, this is coming from a guy who tried waxing his back a couple times. This device actually hurts MORE. At first, I thought she was using it wrong. We tried it on my upper arms to make sure. It pulled and yanked and was extremely unpleasant. Even on patches of shorter hair, it was painful. I didn't dare use it on my nether-regions as the advertisements suggest. It was so painful, I finally grabbed it from my girlfriend and threw it against the floor, where it burst into shards of plastic and metal components. They are now serving a higher purpose as landfill material. I cannot recommend this product. I'd like to see the snarky gentleman in the website promotion actually use the product himself, and see if that smirk stays on his face for long.

  970. I purchased my first BG 2020 in May of 2006. I used it several times a week and within a few weeks it started making a terrible rattling noise. This noise was the cutter and foil rattling in the head. This also caused the cutter and foil assembly to fall out regularly. It was effectively worn out after a few weeks. I contacted Philips and had to send in the original BG for a replacement. After using the replacement, same thing happened. It's not durable at all- apparently they only planned on the user using it once a month. If used once a month, it MIGHT last a year. It's definitely NOT designed to be used every day or every other day, unless you want to replace it every few weeks.<br /><br />It needs to be completely redesigned as far as the cutter/foil goes so it will be more durable.
  971. It is a good product in its range. Easy to use. Trims and shaves well. But do not use cream, soap or any other lathering.
  972. You come to expect a certain level of quality and efficacy of products from major name brands. This is the first item I have bought in years from such a major brand that is completely useless, to the point that I complained to Philips Norelco, and am about to throw it in the trash if they won't accept a refund. For starters, the blades are dull and poorly positioned so as to unenthusiastically nibble at hair, rather than actually *cut* it. Secondly, the build quality is horrible. The length attachments snap on, but are nearly impossible to remove; and a forcible attempt to do so actually ejects the whole razor \\"cartridge\\". The same thing happens when you tap it against the sink to disperse clogged hair. The cutting angles are awkward, it is loud and buzzy, and it doesn't hold a charge. In fact, the only good thing I can say about it is that it looks kind of slick. To sum it up: the Bodygroom is horribly ineffective, and I would not recommend it under any circumstances.

  989.   992. This is the first time I've written a review where I found little point in listing what Pros were temporarily available until the device failed. But with the product performingly only moderately before two of them, purchased years apart, failed in exactly the same fashion after a little over a year of light use, I simply cannot recommend this product on any level.<br /><br />I have now owned 2 of the Norelco BG2020 Bodygroom Shavers over the course of 3 years. I probably used the shaver once every 2-3 months (so maybe 4-5 times a year).<br /><br />While the shaver got the job done, it was anything but efficient, requiring 3-6 passes over a single area to get an even trim. There is a palpable sense of frustration when you can see a few hair sticking out longer than the rest, purposely guide them into the guard combs, only for them to remain after a pass. When using the trimmer without a length guard in order to fully remove the hair, sensitive areas would be irritated as if I'd used a dull razor (e.g. using cologne or body spray would cause a burning sensation for one or two days afterwards).<br /><br />I owned my first one for about a year and a half until I was awakened in the middle of the night by a loud buzzing and vibrating coming from one of my drawers. The shaver had turned itself on in the middle of the night (it was not attached to the charging station, simply stored in the drawer). After some diagnosing, I discovered that the power button was malfunctioning. Initially it wouldn't respond when trying to turn it off, but when I used a pen to apply pressure in random various areas, I was finally able to get the shaver to turn off.<br /><br />When it wouldn't turn back on (even after a 24 hour attempt to recharge it), I finally peeled the rubber off of the button to visually inspect the underlying electronics and button contact. The electronic button itself had stopped working for whatever reason.<br /><br />A few months later (approximately a year and a halfafter purchasing the first one), I picked up another one, assuming the button failure was a fluke.<br /><br />Just over a year after purchasing it, I had a deja vu moment where I awoke to a loud buzzing and vibration from my dressing area. This time the razor was stored on a countertop, seated in the charging base (which had been unplugged after it had charged). The EXACT SAME problem with the power button killed this second one. Even if the shaver had still been covered by the warranty, I wouldn't have bothered to have it replaced given my history with the product.<br /><br />I've found the $13 Norelco G370 All-In-1 Grooming kit trims even body hair far more reliably and quickly than the Bodygoom ever did. I am now using an old one of these (still working reliably almost 5 years later) for body hair maintenance while using a new one for facial hair.
  993. I have had this product for about 3 months and used it three times. Initially was satisfied with the results except that it pulls hair instead of cutting at times. The third time I used it after a full charge the shaver would turn off when turned upside down. It felt like it had no power and totally started to rip the hair off of my chest. I went to return the product and you only have a month to do so. Very disappointed in Amazon and this product. DO NOT BUY!

  1026. Will shave you so close that you will be amazed.... I have had it now for two years and I've never had a closer painless shave. This shaves closer than a straight edge or traditional razor.

  1028. Either I got a flawed one, or this shaver plain stinks.. I tried it on my legs and it was like I hadn't even shaved. I don't have super coarse leg hair, nor do I have overly-soft hair. At first I thought I was using it wrong, but after going over the same area multiple times, holding the shaver at all different angles, I gave up and went back to my regular shaver and shaving cream.<br /><br />Nice concept, and it would have been great if my husband and I could have used it for multiple 'areas' but this is being returned immediately.

  1034. Pros: Works as advertised - doesn't snag skin and trims hair closely.<br /><br />Cons: The clips that hold the foil in fell off after 4 years of light use. The shaver would occasionally get stuck in the &#34;on&#34; position and the only way to turn it off would be to wait 5 minutes before trying the on/off button again.
  1035. Like the product. It does the job and wont knick you up with cuts.   1039. Performs as expected.
  1040. Truth be told, this item works well. It doesn't pinch often, trims easily and with precision. Unfortunately, the battery life isn't very good at all. Also, while sitting in the cabinet, the button broke itself into the on position while I was in bed at 6:30 AM Easter Sunday, making an obnoxious sound, which in my newly awakened haze, was quite worrying. Seriously, how the hell does that even happen? The button, was literally broken 'on', and I hadn't used it in a week! Sadly, I had to break the thing into pieces to get it to stop, including snapping off the top half, pinching the motor post with pliers, and tearing the guts open until I could break the button back 'off'.<br /><br />Its a shame Philips makes so many good products, otherwise i would add them to my 'no way, no how' list. As it stands, I will never buy any electric razors or trimmers from Philips ever again.
  1041. Most women take care of their hair but many of us men have no clue what product to use for ours, we want to look good but shaver experience scares us. Relax, this thing really works! The pearl drop shape of the trimmer teeth makes knocking down the forest safe and comfortable compared to older trimmers. As long as you go slow and are patient, you and your significant other can decide how trim things need to be. Mine happens to like my man-sacks silky smooth and this trimmer delivers. The trick is to go slow, stretch your skin and don't press hard, just run over it a few times. This trimmer works well anywhere, and even they don't advise your face, wet yours after you shave and get a super close shave that's soft. So I give this item a large thumbs up for air management, male or female as long as you remember there's vibrating blades involved, so only press as hard as it takes to remove the unwanted hair. On most places on the body, a quick swipe of the trimmer and then a follow through of the foil will work well. I would suggest buying a new screen/head right away because you are going to love how well and balanced it is. Add a gillette proglide power to knock the large forest down (and a damn good facial shave) and u have everything you need for hair management.
  1042. My second one and I love it. It works great.
  1043. easy to catch hair in the groomer and easy to irritate the skin...
  1044. It works well, but the charge runs out fast, to the point that you should either leave it on the charger daily, if you're a hirsute constant groomer, or plan sessions 12 hours in advance so the device has adequate time to power up. good, not great. it's a fine choice and i would probably buy this one again
  1045. Groomer works fine. One full charge of the battery lasts for several shaves.
  1046. Not good, cheep and battery wears out before done shaving, junk.
  1047. I bought this item because of the good reviews. Yeah, do yourself a favor and just don't. I'm not a hairy guy, but for some reason, buying a body trimmer seems to be an impossible task. I wouldn't buy it again.<br /><br />If anyone actually knows of a GOOD wet/dry body trimmer, please email me at noeffects@comcast.net and let me know, because so far, I'm stuck having to remain plugged in to the outlet and doing it dry. :/
